commit_message:
OVS agent add functional tests of OVS status

Add a functional tests to verify that the agent
behaves correctly when OVS restarted.

Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent
Change-Id: Ifeb0f2f6a06baead93df2c016ea26bfea990734d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/42/205442/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_ovs_dead(self): agent = self.create_agent() agent.check_ovs_status = mock.Mock() agent._agent_has_updates = mock.Mock(return_value=True) def _ovs_dead_then_ok(): if agent.check_ovs_status.call_count < 5: # verify the agent doesn't enter the processing loop self.assertFalse(agent._agent_has_updates.called) return constants.OVS_DEAD else: return constants.OVS_NORMAL agent.check_ovs_status.side_effect = _ovs_dead_then_ok self.start_agent(agent) agent_utils.wait_until_true(lambda: agent._agent_has_updates.called) def test_reprocess_port_when_ovs_restarts(self): agent = self.create_agent() agent.check_ovs_status = mock.Mock() agent.check_ovs_status.side_effect = [ constants.OVS_NORMAL, constants.OVS_RESTARTED ] self.start_agent(agent) network = self._create_test_network_dict() ports = self._create_ports(network, agent) self._plug_ports(network, ports, agent) up_ports_ids = [p['id'] for p in ports] agent_utils.wait_until_true( lambda: self._expected_plugin_rpc_call( agent.plugin_rpc.update_device_up, up_ports_ids)) # OVS restarted agent_utils.wait_until_true( lambda: self._expected_plugin_rpc_call( agent.plugin_rpc.update_device_up, up_ports_ids))

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-28 08:59:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/28d60c2534217f037d647a75e9bc09f04f0cafd0', 'message': 'Change tox default targets for quick use

This change makes it so that if you call `tox` or `tox -r` you will
get a useful result as a developer running tests:

    * py27 and py34 unit tests
    * a single functional test run (using mongodb)
    * pep8

This is slightly different from what was there before which was
as above but _two_ functional test runs, with mysql and postgresql.

The goal here is to make it dead simple for someone to (as quickly

Change-Id: I27dcf5265dea18be541b8b2857b0a135ff22f499
'}]
commit_message:
Change tox default targets for quick use

This change makes it so that if you call `tox` or `tox -r` you will
get a useful result as a developer running tests:

    * py27 and py34 unit tests
    * a single functional test run (using mongodb)
    * pep8

This is slightly different from what was there before which was
as above but _two_ functional test runs, with mysql and postgresql.

The goal here is to make it dead simple for someone to (as quickly
as possible) make sure that there code is okay before committing.

Change-Id: I27dcf5265dea18be541b8b2857b0a135ff22f499

subject: Adds ability to have multi-cloud environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-02 17:35:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/8a341e20a3627d127a4d069dd5e7bc41842216dc', 'message': 'Adds ability to have multi-cloud environments

Cloud-related properties were moved to a separate class Cloud with Environment now
being a descendant of this class. Additional clouds may be placed into environment
in a form of Cloud application. Any application or OpenStack resource can reference
 Cloud using $.cloud optional property. When application references cloud all its child
 objects withing object model would be pointed to that cloud (Heat stack) instead of
 default one (that is from Environment)

 Applications that want to take advantage of this functionality should use
 $.getCloud().stack instead of $.find(std:Environment).stack to access
 correct Heat stack

 Existing application would still work without any change as long as they are not
 tested within something referencing non-default cloud

Change-Id: I1d1c3413e645ecaac4208ae553cd91ba97f98a88

commit_message:
Adds ability to have multi-cloud environments

Cloud-related properties were moved to a separate class Cloud with Environment now
being a descendant of this class. Additional clouds may be placed into environment
in a form of Cloud application. Any application or OpenStack resource can reference
 Cloud using $.cloud optional property. When application references cloud all its child
 objects withing object model would be pointed to that cloud (Heat stack) instead of
 default one (that is from Environment)

 Applications that want to take advantage of this functionality should use
 $.getCloud().stack instead of $.find(std:Environment).stack to access
 correct Heat stack

 Existing application would still work without any change as long as they are not
 tested within something referencing non-default cloud

Change-Id: I1d1c3413e645ecaac4208ae553cd91ba97f98a88
Implements: blueprint multiple-heat-stacks
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/17/125717/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Namespaces: =: io.murano res: io.murano.resources sys: io.murano.system Name: Cloud Properties: name: Contract: $.string().notNull() regionName: Contract: $.string() stack: Contract: $.class(sys:HeatStack) Usage: Runtime defaultNetworks: Contract: environment: $.class(res:Network) flat: $.class(res:Network) Usage: In securityGroupManager: Contract: $.class(sys:SecurityGroupManager) Usage: Runtime Methods: initialize: Body: - $generatedEnvironmentName: $.getAttr(generatedCloudName) - If: $generatedCloudName = null Then: - $generatedCloudName: randomName() - $.setAttr(generatedCloudName, $generatedCloudName) - $stackDescriptionFormat: 'This stack was generated by Murano for environment {0} (ID: {1})' - $this.stack: new(sys:HeatStack, name => 'murano-' + $generatedCloudName, description => $stackDescriptionFormat.format($.name, $.id()), regionName => $.regionName ) - If: $.defaultNetworks.environment = null and $.defaultNetworks.flat = null Then: $this.securityGroupManager: new(sys:AwsSecurityGroupManager, cloud => $this) Else: $this.securityGroupManager: new(sys:NeutronSecurityGroupManager, cloud => $this) destroy: Body: - $.stack.delete()

commit_message:
Remove master count from magnum bay-list

This patch will remove master_count
when you do magnum bay-list because
right now master_count is for k8 bays
only but it get listed for all kind of
bays.

Change-Id: I6e8db77b5964573c09a6326143453503e76ad33d
Closes-Bug: #1491184

subject: Split "thread_2" into "one_controller_actions" and "multirole"
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/34/220534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test() class OneNodeDeploy(TestBasic): """OneNodeDeploy. DEPRECATED!""" # TODO documentation@test(groups=["one_controller_actions"]) @test(depends_on=[deploy_ha_one_controller_neutron], groups=["delete_environment"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def delete_environment(self): """Delete existing environment and verify nodes returns to unallocated state Scenario: 1. Revert "deploy_ha_one_controller" environment 2. Delete environment 3. Verify node returns to unallocated pull Duration 15m """ self.env.revert_snapshot("deploy_ha_one_controller_neutron") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() self.fuel_web.client.delete_cluster(cluster_id) nailgun_nodes = self.fuel_web.client.list_nodes() nodes = filter(lambda x: x["pending_deletion"] is True, nailgun_nodes) assert_true( len(nodes) == 2, "Verify 2 node has pending deletion status" ) wait( lambda: self.fuel_web.is_node_discovered(nodes[0]) and self.fuel_web.is_node_discovered(nodes[1]), timeout=10 * 60, interval=15 ) @test(groups=["multirole"])@test(groups=["multirole"])@test(groups=["multirole"])@test(enabled=False)
deleted_lines: @test(groups=["thread_2"]) class OneNodeDeploy(TestBasic): """OneNodeDeploy.""" # TODO documentation@test(groups=["thread_2"]) @test(groups=["thread_2", "multirole"])@test(groups=["thread_2", "multirole"])@test(groups=["thread_2"])@test(groups=["thread_2"])@test(groups=["ha_one_controller"]) class HAOneControllerCinder(TestBasic): """HAOneControllerCinder.""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_3], groups=["deploy_ha_one_controller_cinder"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def deploy_ha_one_controller_cinder(self): """Deploy cluster in HA mode with cinder Scenario: 1. Create cluster in Ha mode 2. Add 1 node with controller role 3. Add 1 node with compute role 4. Add 1 node with cinder role 5. Deploy the cluster 6. Validate cluster was set up correctly, there are no dead services, there are no errors in logs 7. Run OSTF Duration 30m Snapshot: deploy_ha_one_controller_cinder """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_3_slaves") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings={ "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPE } ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['compute'], 'slave-03': ['cinder'] } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id)) self.fuel_web.assert_cluster_ready(os_conn, smiles_count=5) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.env.verify_network_configuration("slave-01") self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id=cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot("deploy_ha_one_controller_cinder") @test(groups=["thread_2", "test"]) class DeleteEnvironment(TestBasic): """DeleteEnvironment.""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on=[HAOneControllerNeutron.deploy_ha_one_controller_neutron], groups=["delete_environment"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def delete_environment(self): """Delete existing environment and verify nodes returns to unallocated state Scenario: 1. Revert "deploy_ha_one_controller" environment 2. Delete environment 3. Verify node returns to unallocated pull Duration 15m """ self.env.revert_snapshot("deploy_ha_one_controller_neutron") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() self.fuel_web.client.delete_cluster(cluster_id) nailgun_nodes = self.fuel_web.client.list_nodes() nodes = filter(lambda x: x["pending_deletion"] is True, nailgun_nodes) assert_true( len(nodes) == 2, "Verify 2 node has pending deletion status" ) wait( lambda: self.fuel_web.is_node_discovered(nodes[0]) and self.fuel_web.is_node_discovered(nodes[1]), timeout=10 * 60, interval=15 )

commit_message:
Sed fix to update the file

Fix to change the file adding a .bak of the original for the
timout. Also changed the timeout to 10 min (600 sec) that is
more than enough.

Change-Id: I36a3ca68a1d9d609056fe5e4c59d2831fcd0095b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-ceilometer refs/changes/24/220624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i.bak '/get_url:/s/$/ timeout=600/' $filename

commit_message:
Refactor root ssh config, add admin net and domain to list of host nets

SSH config for root user should use key auth regardless of
hostname. This enables deployment to hosts that have IP addresses
outside of RFC 1918 ranges.

Host network should include admin network expressed by wildcard.
Added extra_admin_networks and Fuel DNS domain in the list as well.

Added new function ipcalc_network_wildcard

Change-Id: I21501feb9e2f9cce83600596889f3f9b89174310
Closes-Bug: #1491912
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Ilyin <dilyin@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/51/220251/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunction(:ipcalc_network_wildcard, :type => :rvalue, :doc => <<-EOS Returns network wildcard by host ip address and netmask. EOS ) do |arguments| require 'ipaddr' if (arguments.size != 2) then raise(Puppet::ParseError, "ipcalc_network_wilrdcard(): Wrong number of arguments "+ "given #{arguments.size} for 2") end begin ip = arguments[0] mask = arguments[1] address = IPAddr.new("#{ip}/#{mask}") class << address def mask_length @mask_addr.to_s(2).count("1") end def wildcard_notation return unless ipv4? octets = mask_length / 8 pattern = [] (0...octets).map do |i| pattern << ((@addr >> (24 - 8 * i)) & 0xff) end pattern << '*' if octets < 4 pattern.join '.' end end return address.wildcard_notation rescue ArgumentError raise(Puppet::ParseError, "ipcalc_network_wildcard(): bad arguments #{arguments[0]} #{arguments[1]}") end end end

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-30 22:04:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/a4c1196f483ca8dcbdaf27c78c92607e8e3eabd3', 'message': '{WiP} Context versioning

Change-Id: I0a553e8044061fe780a83bc04d70b8f80580988f
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-30 22:12:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/31c47d57be4fa22c99f9d293d085bb9b04b017f8', 'message': 'yaql context versioning

This commit reworks mechanism how context chain
is built at each point. The goal was to make
entire chain be dependent on format version
number. This would allow for example to use
yaql 1.0 legacy mode context for MuranoPL/1.0
and not to use it for 2.0.

Not the entire chain is built on demand up to the
root instead of attaching to existed parent context 
as it was before. DSL host (engine) is no more
required to have custom MuranoDslExecutor implementation
but a new ContextManager interface that is used
to control contexts on each layer. Engine uses
this interface to register system classes and
engine level yaql functions. Also a ContextManager
is a foundation for method mocking because now
all MuranoPL methods are yaql fucntions stored
in context and with ContextManager it is possible
to inject/replace function in each scope (
global, package, class, object)


Partially implements: blueprint murano-versioning

Change-Id: I0a553e8044061fe780a83bc04d70b8f80580988f

entire chain be dependent on format version
number. This would allow for example to use
yaql 1.0 legacy mode context for MuranoPL/1.0
and not to use it for 2.0.

Not the entire chain is built on demand up to the
root instead of attaching to existed parent context
as it was before. DSL host (engine) is no more
required to have custom MuranoDslExecutor implementation
but a new ContextManager interface that is used

commit_message:
yaql context versioning

This commit reworks mechanism how context chain
is built at each point. The goal was to make
entire chain be dependent on format version
number. This would allow for example to use
yaql 1.0 legacy mode context for MuranoPL/1.0
and not to use it for 2.0.

Not the entire chain is built on demand up to the
root instead of attaching to existed parent context
as it was before. DSL host (engine) is no more
required to have custom MuranoDslExecutor implementation
but a new ContextManager interface that is used
to control contexts on each layer. Engine uses
this interface to register system classes and
engine level yaql functions. Also a ContextManager
is a foundation for method mocking because now
all MuranoPL methods are yaql functions stored
in context and with ContextManager it is possible
to inject/replace function in each scope (
global, package, class, object)

Partially implements: blueprint murano-versioning

Change-Id: I0a553e8044061fe780a83bc04d70b8f80580988f

commit_message:
Changes to allow sphinx to build correctly

This should allow our documentation to post to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/anchor

Running locally both pass:
python setup.py build_sphinx
tox -e venv python setup.py build_sphinx

"tox -e docs" still works and you can run
that if you desire.

"tox -e venv python setup.py build_sphinx"
is what's required to work by infra so that
documentation can be built upstream and
published to the developer documentation pages.
It also allows the documentation jobs to run in
the gate so that documentation is built at
review time.

Change-Id: If67961a1b68223ed4ca002037cb7e8c6a51fbe3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/anchor refs/changes/89/220289/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Let tasks run to completion on workflow error

If the workflow state is ERROR, any tasks that are still in RUNNING state
is unable to mark completion. User thinks mistral has an orphaned task
that is infinitely running. Also, this workflow will not be able to resume
from error because the task is now stuck in RUNNING.

Change-Id: Ifa1cf6bbb5d0b20c2ac396360e745f8c22ce1813
Closes-Bug: #1490003

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");import eventlet from mistral.workflow import utils as wf_utils action: std.noop task2: action: std.async_noop on-complete: - task3 task3: action: std.noop def test_started_task_run_to_completion(self): self._await( lambda: self.is_execution_in_state(self.exec_id, states.RUNNING) ) wf_ex = db_api.get_execution(self.exec_id) self._await(lambda: self.is_task_success(wf_ex.task_executions[0].id)) # This is required to give the engine time to start task2. eventlet.sleep(1) self.engine.stop_workflow(self.exec_id, states.ERROR, "Failure") self._await(lambda: self.is_execution_error(self.exec_id)) wf_ex = db_api.get_execution(self.exec_id) self.assertEqual(states.ERROR, wf_ex.state) self.assertEqual("Failure", wf_ex.state_info) self.assertEqual(2, len(wf_ex.task_executions)) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, wf_ex.task_executions[0].state) self.assertEqual(states.RUNNING, wf_ex.task_executions[1].state) self.engine.on_action_complete( wf_ex.task_executions[1].executions[0].id, wf_utils.Result("Completed") ) eventlet.sleep(1) wf_ex = db_api.get_execution(self.exec_id) self.assertEqual(states.ERROR, wf_ex.state) self.assertEqual("Failure", wf_ex.state_info) self.assertEqual(2, len(wf_ex.task_executions)) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, wf_ex.task_executions[0].state) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, wf_ex.task_executions[1].state)

add section describing method use in http

In order to help people designing new APIs add a section on http
method use, which methods are expected for what.

Change-Id: I7e9c2e2eec9cc83029f898b2dda78d77fb2924f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/38/189738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: HTTP defines a concept of METHODS on a resource uri. .. +-------------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------+ | METHOD | URI | ACTION | HAS BODY? | +-------------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------+ | HEAD | /foo/ID | EXISTS | NO | +-------------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------+ | GET | /foo/ID | READ | NO | +-------------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------+ | POST | /foo | CREATE | YES | +-------------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------+ | PUT | /foo/ID | UPDATE | YES | +-------------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------+ | PATCH | /foo/ID | UPDATE (partial) | YES | +-------------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------+ | DELETE | /foo/ID | DELETE | NO | +-------------+--------------+--------------------+--------------------+ This looks close to a CRUD mapping, but it's important to realize the defining characteristic of POST isn't that it creates items, but that you POST to a URI that's different than the resource you get back. POST is therefor also appropriate for bulk operations like multiple update, or triggering some arbitrary other actions beyond resource creation (i.e. reboot a server). **TODO**: HEAD is weird in a bunch of our wsgi frameworks and you don't have access to it. Figure out if there is anything useful there.

commit_message:
add section describing 501 common mistake

This documents why we got to this massive misuse of 501, and why it's
wrong. Original mailing list thread is provided. This attempts to
provide the best explanations on why, and what the implications of
using 501 incorrectly could be.

Change-Id: Ie4b4cb376c6265b7833c97f99e1770e2e54e1f45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/56/183456/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Common Mistakes --------------- There are many common mistakes that have been made in implementations in OpenStack. This section attempts to enumerate them with reasons why they were wrong, and propose future alternatives. Use of 501 - Method Not Found ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Some time in the Folsom era projects started using 501 for "Feature Not Implemented" - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-December/003759.html This is a completely incorrect reading of HTTP. "Method" means something very specific in HTTP, it means an HTTP Method. One of GET / HEAD / POST / PUT / PATCH / OPTIONS / TRACE. The purpose of the 501 error was to indicate to the client that PATCH is not now, and never will be an appropriate method to call on any resource on the server. And appropriate client action is to blacklist PATCH and ensure no code attempts to use this. This comes from early days of HTTP where there were hundreds of commercial HTTP server implementations, and the assumption that all HTTP methods would be handled by a server was not something the vendors could agree on. We live in a very different world today, dominated by Apache and Nginx. As such 501 is something you'd be unlikely to see in the wild. However that doesn't mean we can replace it's definition with our own. Going forward projects should use a 400 'BadRequest' response for this condition, plus a more specific error message back to the user that feature was not implemented in that cloud.

commit_message:
Added note about caching of responses when using https

Change-Id: Ife6e3ba8491539e1aa67bb6ae7ba7ea168f6315e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/88/185288/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: A common misconception is that requests issued over a secure HTTP connection are not cached for security reasons. In fact, there is no exception made for https in the HTTP specification, caching works in exactly the same way as for non-encrypted HTTP. Most modern browsers apply the same caching algorithm to secure connections.

commit_message:
Release python-novaclient 2.28.1

This is to get the fix for 6fc3a94 into a release and then make 2.28.1
the minimum required version for liberty in global-requirements to also
pick up the other fixes for the recent v2.0 on v2.1 failures.

There is another change d970de4 in here but it actually doesn't do
anything since novaclient isn't translated.

Related-Bug: #1492242

Change-Id: Ia633181c806bd0200a869e6b2102e4a9d560c56a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/04/220604/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-21 15:13:33.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/headers.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/api-sig/commit/d72b50687f1d6e5476ca71e5d94a19f8e1d851dc', 'message': 'Require "OpenStack-" in headers

Change-Id: I07628e924320c6493ed9a8ac8ae37a7a50be2008

commit_message:
Require "OpenStack-" in headers

Previous now-merged patchset [1] allowed for making headers prefixed
only with the service name (Baremetal-FooBar) instead of
OpenStack-Baremetal-FooBar.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186526

Change-Id: I07628e924320c6493ed9a8ac8ae37a7a50be2008
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/83/215683/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with other applications. To do this, use "OpenStack" and the service name in the header. An example might be "OpenStack-Compute-FooBar", which is unlikely to be standardized already or conflict with existing headers.standardized might be ``OpenStack-Identity-Status`` Some headers that are at risk for conflicts might look like:: OpenStack-Identity-Account-ID OpenStack-Networking-Host-Name OpenStack-Object-Storage-Policy
deleted_lines: with other applications. The simplest way to do this is to use either OpenStack, the service name, or both in the header. An example might be "OpenStack-Auth" or "Compute-FooBar", which are unlikely to be standardized already or conflict with existing headers.standardized might be:: Instance-Image-ACL OpenStack-Identity-Status Some headers that are at risk for conflicts might look like:: OpenStack-Account-ID OpenStack-Host-Name OpenStack-Storage-Policy

commit_message:
Migrate the old snmp pollsters to new declarative pollster

Delete all the old snmp pollsters and to register the new declarative
snmp pollster to be used.

Change-Id: I8ebb2a53bca52eed77229d4cc56cf1f42aaa1a7b
Implements: blueprint declarative-snmp-metrics

commit_message:
Hyper-V: refactors utilsfactory

The Hyper-V API can change from a version to another (e.g. new
features), requiring a new Utils class to be added for specific
versions.

Refactors utilsfactory module. In this way, a new utils class
can be added without adding a new parameter when retrieving the
suitable class for windows version.

Change-Id: I1ea398473947a0d9afea08c08fea09dc09afea09

subject: Hyper-V: deprecates support for Windows / Hyper-V Server 2008 R2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-04 16:38:10.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/utilsfactory.py', 'hyperv/nova/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv/commit/f2496054a3b983c72a799958377122b1df8e3ddb', 'message': 'Hyper-V: deprecates support for Windows / Hyper-V Server 2008 R2

support for it will be removed starting with Mitaka.

Adds a log warning in the HyperVDriver if the os version is older
than 6.2 (older than Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012) during
initialization.

Note: hyperv.nova.utilsfactory now imports the config options from nova

'}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: deprecates support for Windows / Hyper-V Server 2008 R2

Hyper-V Server 2008 R2 is deprecated for Liberty and will the
support for it will be removed starting with Mitaka.

Adds a log warning in the HyperVDriver if the os version is older
than 6.2 (older than Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012) during
initialization.

Note: hyperv.nova.utilsfactory now imports the config options from nova
in order to avoid registering the same config options twice.

Change-Id: Ia93b3317509da7765fff8cc28f9a9980d9433a9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/81/220581/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from hyperv.i18n import _, _LWfrom hyperv.nova import hostutils # check if the current version is older than kernel version 6.2 # (Windows Server 2012) if not hostutils.HostUtils().check_min_windows_version(6, 2): # the version is Windows Server 2008 R2. Log a warning, letting # users know that this version is deprecated in Liberty. LOG.warning( _LW('You are running nova-compute on Windows / Hyper-V Server ' '2008 R2. This version of Windows is deprecated in the ' 'current version of OpenStack and the support for it will ' 'be removed in the next cycle.'))

commit_message:
Fix NG Launch Instance handling of Inf. instance quota

There are two problems with having infinite instance quota in this code:
first, nova is returning a token of Infinity in JSON, which is not proper;
second, the JavaScript isn't handling Infinity properly.

Change-Id: Idfc0b5126d31fc3918b60850c0491ebe78573aec
Closes-Bug: 1492265
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/18/220518/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json # This currently may contain Infinity as a token in the JSON # response; this is NOT valid JSON. tmp = json.dumps(result) tmp = tmp.replace('Infinity', '-1') return json.loads(tmp)

commit_message:
acceptance: enable loadbalancer service_plugin

Thanks to http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/commit/?id=f4e980f7d5608b594e64d5ab78c594d61a664955
Neutron should now be able to enable load loadbalancer service plugin in
RDO packaging.

This patch aims to re-enable the test again to validate Liberty can
enable LBaaS service.

Change-Id: I1375980cfefd5dd5bf1fc814907eb2746201d568
Closes-Bug: #1490990

commit_message:
Update Active/Standby blueprint

This patch updates the Active/Standby bluprint to:
1. fix asciiflow rendering problem.
2. update the datamodel impact section to include actual changes in
   current review 206252.
3. update the api impact section to include the amphorae rest api
   changes.
4. discuss further performance impact that must be taken care of when
   developing services health checks for VRRP.

Change-Id: I6bddfc628ebf615f5c2966f2ef1837899cd122bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/87/218387/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: asciiflow:: +--------+ | Tenant | |Service | | (1) | +--------+ +-----------+ | +--------+ +----+ Master +----+ | | Tenant | |VIP | Amphora |IP1 | | |Service | +--+-+-----+-----+-+--+ | | (M) | | |MGMT |VRRP | | | +--------+ | | IP | IP1 | | | | Tenant | +--+--++----+ | | | Network | | | | +-----------------+ Floating +---------+ v-v-------------^----+---v-^----v-^-+ Router | IP | | ^---------------+----v-^---+------+-+Floating <-> VIP <----------+ Internet| | Management | | | | | | | | | (MGMT) | | | | +-----------------+ +---------+ | Network | +--+--++----+ | | Paired |MGMT |VRRP | | | | | IP | IP2 | | +-----------+ | +-----+-----+ | | Octavia | ++---+ Backup +-+--+ |Controller | |VIP | Amphora |IP2 | | (s) | +----+-----------+----+ +-----------+* New columns in the amphora table shall indicate the VRRP priority, the VRRP ID, and the VRRP interface of the amphora. * A new column in the listener table shall indicate the TCP port used for listener internal data synchronization. * A new table shall hold the VRRP main configuration primitives including at least: VRRP authentication information, role and priority advertisement interval. A VRRP group shall be a property the loadbalancer. ** Changes to amphora API: see [11] ** PUT /listeners/{amphora_id}/{listener_id}/{peer_name}/haproxy PUT /vrrp/upload PUT /vrrp/{action} GET /interface/{ip_addr} The VRRP requires executing health checks in the amphorae at fine grain granularity period. The health checks shall be as lightweight as possible such that VRRP is able to execute all check scripts within a predefined interval. If the check scripts failed to run within this predefined interval, VRRP may become unstable and may alternate the amphorae roles between MASTER and BACKUP incorrectly.Sherif Abdelwahab (abdelwas)

commit_message:
Add migrating task state to NPIV wwpns call

If a VM is migrating, a call to the wwpns method should not add the
WWPNs to the mgmt LPAR.  This change set fixes that issue and adds unit
testing around it.

Change-Id: Ic60d586cb04a3c163f5271d85bca7743435bfaa1

commit_message:
Multivalue selection for metadata widget

There is no way to choose multiple values for Features of
Compute Host Capabilities while updating Flavor Metadata currently.
Provides possibility for choosing multiple values of Flavor Metadata.

Change-Id: Ice9ad339437588a5698cd60c6fa9eeee9b89fdce
Implements: blueprint metadata-widget-multivalue-selection

commit_message:
Hide any loadbalancer tab if no actions are permitted on such tab

The clause `from openstack_dashboard import policy` is temporary and
will be removed from inside the function as soon as policy backend
moves to openstack_auth (it is inside the function to avoid recursive
imports).

Change-Id: Id4548dd37d0b92e298732100890e904c72a67b33
Partial-Bug: #1395434

commit_message:
Revert the use of lazy loading for mox

    The current fix to make mox not needed in a non dev environment
    includes a lazy-loading pattern in
    horizon/test/jasmine/jasmine.py. This is undesirable because
    we'd like to keep the imports at the top of the file.

Change-Id: I3dbe14da8d5012bf555fb79e0ee054a139f98380
Closes-Bug: 1298473
Co-Authored-By: florent <florent.flament-ext@cloudwatt.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maxime Vidori <maxime.vidori@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Moves the Floating IP from compute to Networking

This patch moves the Floating IPs tab from Access & Security to
Networking panels group.

Change-Id: I585d51fbeeeb36e631557bee1fae476f8f6f08d2
Closes-bug: #1409464

commit_message:
Normalize and parameterize sass files to simplify design changes

When customizing OpenStack Horizon design, multiple files have to be changed
because properties are hard-coded into different files.For instance, the red
color into '_accordion_nav.scss' is defined multiple times into this file. Some
Sass files use -webkit prefix on CSS3 properties while other prefixes are not
managed. It implies that minor and old browsers don't have the same design.
'_charts.scss' file doesn't respect the same syntax that others and is harder
to read.

This commit facilitates the customization of OpenStack Horizon. By defining all
color values with variables, edition of multiples files is avoided. Also,
prefixes are now defined into mixins definition to manage all existing prefixes:
opera, IE, webkit, old firefox. Finally, '_charts.scss' now respects the same
syntax that the other files.

Change-Id: Ieb3a116dca7bca947b493666eca12600354adbe3

commit_message:
Sample developer sandbox dashboard for UI development

This example adds a new Horizon dashboard used to experiment with
Horizon components in a live installation. This allows a developer
to experiment with new components without editing any of the
production Horizon dashboards.  This example also includes a single
panel with a simple Angular based wait spinner control, built on the
default Horizon wait spinner.

This patch is intended as a developer sample, not for release.

Change-Id: If8a06a3031cffec76d087d2cb2dfce12e70da8bf

commit_message:
Fixes list stacking behavior in users/available project screen

When a user opens the members tab for a project (Identity->
Projects->Edit Project->Project Members), and then shrinks
the browser to a narrow width, the list of available and current
project members merge into one list, while the two headings
become stacked on top of each other, rather than being
separated by their respective lists. The root cause of this
behavior was the arrangement of divs, which had both headers
in a single div, followed by both lists in distinct divs
afterwards. When there is enough space to put the headers
and lists side by side, the browser would do that, but if the
space was shrunken the dom elements are rendered top to bottom.
To fix this, I re-arranged the divs containing the elements
to be a left header plus list, and a right header plus list.

Change-Id: Ibd3d6178e8a960d54ac147594efcdabbdfedd861
Closes-bug:1346647

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/72/122472/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Actions ~~~~~~~ Horizon provides three types of basic action classes which can be taken on a table's data: :class:`~horizon.tables.Action` class which can be used to represent an action which can be taken on the table's data. :class:`~horizon.tables.LinkAction` class which can be used to represent an action which is a link rather than a form POST. :class:`~horizon.tables.FilterAction` class which can be used to represent a filter action on the table's data. There are also shortcut actions which are extensions of the basic Action class: :class:`~horizon.tables.BatchAction` which takes batch action on one or more objects on the table's data. This action should not require user input on a per-object basis. :class:`~horizon.tables.DeleteAction` which can be used to perform delete operations on the table's data. :class:`~horizon.tables.UpdateAction` which can be used to cell perform updates by inline editing on the table's data. .. note:: For more information on the attributes for each action class, please refer to the `Horizon DataTable Documentation`_. .. _Horizon DataTable Documentation: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/ref/tables.html To create an action in the table, open ``tables.py`` file under the ``mypanel`` directory and add the following code:: from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _ from horizon import tables class StartAction (tables.BatchAction): name = "start" action_present = _("Start") action_past = _("Started") # data_type information goes here # policy_rules go here class InstancesTable(tables.DataTable): # same code as shown in example above class Meta: name = "instances" verbose_name = _("Instances") table_actions = (StartAction)

from the parent dashboard. This is consistent with existing dashboards,
but inconsistent with the sample dashboard and panel files used by
startdash and startpanel

A more complete fix is:
1) Remove the sample dashboard Django template file. No other
dashboards have Django template files. Other existing dashboards place
all content in panels registered with that dashboard
2) Fix the sample panel Django template file to no longer reference the
parent dashboard's base.html
3) Update the documentation to be consistent with the new panel's Django
template files

commit_message:
Fixing files used as panel template by startdash

run_tests.sh options 'startdash' and 'startpanel' are used to
automatically generate a new dashboard, or new panel in horizon.

The fix for bug #1325099 introduced a regression where panels added to a
newly created dashboard would not display their main content area. Also
the automatically generated panel Django template was inconsistent with the
tutorial documentation.

Investigation revealed that #1325099 changed the default panel Django template
file to include the horizon 'base.html', instead of the base.html file
from the parent dashboard. This is consistent with existing dashboards,
but inconsistent with the sample dashboard and panel files used by
startdash and startpanel

A more complete fix is:
1) Remove the sample dashboard Django template file. No other
dashboards have Django template files. Other existing dashboards place
all content in panels registered with that dashboard
2) Fix the sample panel Django template file to no longer reference the
parent dashboard's base.html
3) Update the documentation to be consistent with the new panel's Django
template files

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1401332

Change-Id: I87e67cb647a10494ca1558a0f3ce7179d582a38e

commit_message:
Directive to allow editing of table cell values

A widget to support Launch Instance workflow. When used,
this directive allows a value to be editable when clicked, and shows
the user a select menu listing options that are pre-defined from the
controller. When the value changes it is passed back to the parent
ngModel.

Mockup: http://invis.io/8F2185WPR

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

Change-Id: Idef5bd696d26ee8708f3104b7a7ee581bf195395

commit_message:
Modal Wait Spinner Demo

Adds a UI "sandbox" dashboard into Horizon in order to experiment with
the Angular-based modal wait spinner component, compare it to the
existing Horizon wait spinner, and see how the new component can
be used from other modal components like the wizard.

Change-Id: I541a2d665dfa40824be43a780a5d30a8e1a6eeb5

commit_message:
Configurable instance detail tab group

Improve usability when some tabs cannot be used in specific
environments by hiding. For example, VMware environment
doesn't support the console log feature. In that case,
usability will improve if the console log tab is hidden.

Change-Id: Ic1b81f53a69924f0a2c53b9df7932dcc42f677b8
Closes-Bug: #1361529

Horizon needs more space to handle session data. With the Identity
API moving towards V3 (that has a significantly enlarged token),
we need to work with sessions beyond 4KB.
Between the types of session backend offered by Django, we decided

* Unlimited session size
* Reduced traffic between client-server (smaller cookies)

* SQLite is embedded with Python

commit_message:
Add DATABASES to settings.py

Horizon needs more space to handle session data. With the Identity
API moving towards V3 (that has a significantly enlarged token),
we need to work with sessions beyond 4KB.
Between the types of session backend offered by Django, we decided
to opt by the cached_db option. In order to do that and avoid
problems with devstack, we need to follow a procedure:
1 - Add the DATABASES setting on the settings.py to allow 'syncdb'
2 - Make devstack do a 'syncdb' to create the base on deploying
3 - Finally, set the backend to 'cached_db'

Change-Id: I07904dddf75ab4213d9fe4f637f83354feffc1d7
Partial-bug: 1382079
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/94/132594/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SESSION_ENGINE = 'django.contrib.sessions.backends.chached_db'

commit_message:
Display profile information in network details

When the Cisco N1K neutron plugin is being used, network
create requires a network profile to be used. When a network
is subsequently created, this fix will now display the profile
information - id and name, in the network details page.
Involves changes to the views.py file in order to obtain the
profile name and corresponding updates to the test file.

Closes-bug: #1260438

Change-Id: I1af1598446e437c8cb5234e9a218541e87cbce2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/87/76787/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix display of ports when associating floating IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-17 23:02:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/4f3349f2312bee0acbf0003857dba2304ceada51', 'message': 'Fix display of ports when associating floating IP

No port was visible, making it impossible to associate a floating IP to
a port of an instance. This happens when the gateway router is not in
the same tenant as the instance, but still attached to a network shared
accross tenants -- because we were only considering ports in our tenant
to find gateway routers that are reachable.

This fixes a regression introduced in commit 277c7bc7.

commit_message:
Fix display of ports when associating floating IP

No port was visible, making it impossible to associate a floating IP to
a port of an instance. This happens when the gateway router is not in
the same tenant as the instance, but still attached to a network shared
accross tenants -- because we were only considering ports in our tenant
to find gateway routers that are reachable.

This fixes a regression introduced in commit 277c7bc7.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Bechtold <tbechtold@suse.com>
Change-Id: I99c136789382775deb72a253ee6f8339f08bae01
Related-Bug: #1252403
Closes-Bug: #1394051

commit_message:
Ignore Exception in process of Edit Attachments

In the process of "Edit attachments", if we try to detach the
associated VM instance which is already died (by whatever reason)
then Horizon dashboard always pop up the error of
"Error: Unable to retrieve volume information" and the purpose of detaching
can not be completed.

This patch is to ignore this kind of Exception so that the process
can be continued.

Closes-Bug: #1405530
Change-Id: I525973facd02dc98deccb6b22b07208bcc188e7d

commit_message:
Add "Back To Previous Page" link from all Detail pages

While looking at the Instance Details (or any details pages), it
is great to have a quick link to get back to the previous page.
This will give users a quick step back to the full Instances table
view without having to rely on the browser back button.

Change-Id: Icd94a39110561b91418a0d90f42751a3b9c5bf5b
Co-Authored-By: Swati Shukla <swati.shukla1@tcs.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nikunj Aggarwal <nikunj.aggarwal@hp.com>
Closes-Bug: #1100318

commit_message:
[Launch Instance fix] Fix Availability Zone default text

When there are no Availability Zones, this patch addes default text 'No
Available Availability Zones found'.

Change-Id: Idf3a4aa193fd178a1c9d2811aa316c095ba649b6
Closes-bug: #1434275

added_lines: }else if(model.availabilityZones.length == 0){ push.apply(model.availabilityZones, "No availability zones found");

subject: [Launch Instance Fix] Only show bootable vol snaps
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 18:46:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/launch-instance/launch-instance.model.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/cc73025980549381eca9b9afb59659bc4df6421e', 'message': '[Launch Instance Fix] Only show bootable vol snaps

Volume snapshots should only show snapshots which are
linked to bootable volumes. This is not available via
a direct API filter. You have to check if the volume
snapshots parent volume is bootable.

This fix does incur extra performance overhead because
of this.  The alternative is to just list all
volume snapshots and let users guess which ones are actually
bootable.

Change-Id: Icbdaaa93c95a3a63adf4a655ffbd608e7ce39769
Closes-Bug: #1434662
'}]
commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Only show bootable vol snaps

Volume snapshots should only show snapshots which are
linked to bootable volumes. This is not available via
a direct API filter. You have to check if the volume
snapshots parent volume is bootable.

This fix does incur extra performance overhead because
of this.  The alternative is to just list all
volume snapshots and let users guess which ones are actually
bootable.

Change-Id: Icbdaaa93c95a3a63adf4a655ffbd608e7ce39769
Closes-Bug: #1434662
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/43/166343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return cinderAPI.getVolumes({ bootable: 1 }).then(onGetVolumes); return cinderAPI.getVolumeSnapshots({ status: 'available' }).then(onGetVolumeSnapshots); push.apply(model.volumeSnapshots, data.data.items.filter(function (volumeSnapshot) { for( i=0; i < model.volumes.length; i++){ if(model.volumes[i].id === volumeSnapshot.volume_id){ return true; } } return false; })); var i = model.volumes.length; while (i--){ if (model.volumes[i].status !== 'available') { model.volumes.splice(i); } }
deleted_lines: var volumeLoadPromises = []; volumeLoadPromises.push(cinderAPI.getVolumes({ status: 'available', bootable: 1 }).then(onGetVolumes)); volumeLoadPromises.push(cinderAPI.getVolumeSnapshots({ status: 'available' }).then(onGetVolumeSnapshots)); return $q.all(volumeLoadPromises); push.apply(model.volumeSnapshots, data.data.items);

subject: Primary Project made optional in horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-10 11:45:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6101c6e04c9822f82dbf52a4e1aa44ec58bc50c5', 'message': 'Horizon, python-keystoneclient treat "primary
project" / tenantId differently

While creating a user, the primary project field
was mandatory in Horizon and was optional in
python-keystoneclient. Now, the primary project
has been made optional in Horizon as well and will
allow user to create a project without mapping it
to any project.

The command keystone user-create is now consistent
on both the interfaces.

Change-Id: I94545e70b6fc364d8e92e5c05de304f41500282d
Closes-Bug: #1285138

commit_message:
Primary Project made optional in horizon

While creating a user, the primary project field
was mandatory in Horizon and was optional in
python-keystoneclient. Now, the primary project
has been made optional in Horizon as well
and will allow user to create a user without
mapping it to any project.

The command keystone user-create is now
consistent on both the interfaces.

Changes as per the comments received:
1. Added new test cases
2. To maintain consistency between CreateUserForm
and UpdateUserform, Primary Project has been
made optional in the UpdateUserForm as well.

Change-Id: I94545e70b6fc364d8e92e5c05de304f41500282d
Closes-Bug: #1285138

commit_message:
[WIP Launch Instance] Instance Summary (quick launch)

Example of an instance summary page that allows creating
basic instances from the first step of the Angular-based
launch instance wizard.

This is just an experiment for now, exploring one possible
way to allow for easy launching of "simple" instances.

Change-Id: I126de7501b2d46f90612bd66b9e19835a488860b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/49/168749/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (function () { 'use strict'; var module = angular.module('hz.dashboard.launch-instance'); module.controller('LaunchInstanceDetailsCtrl', [ '$scope', 'launchInstanceModel', LaunchInstanceDetailsCtrl ]); module.controller('LaunchInstanceDetailsHelpCtrl', [ LaunchInstanceDetailsHelpCtrl ]); function LaunchInstanceDetailsCtrl($scope, model) { var ctrl = this; ctrl.model = model; ctrl.newInstanceSpec = model.newInstanceSpec; ctrl.label = { title: gettext('Instance Summary'), subtitle: gettext('For more details or advanced options, use the appropriate details tab'), instanceName: gettext('Instance Name'), availabilityZone: gettext('Availability Zone'), instance_count: gettext('Instance Count') }; // Labels used by quota charts ctrl.chartTotalInstancesLabel = gettext('Total Instances'); ctrl.chartTotalVcpusLabel = gettext('Total VCPUs'); ctrl.chartTotalRamLabel = gettext('Total RAM'); ctrl.instanceChartData = {}; ctrl.vcpusChartData = {}; ctrl.ramChartData = {}; ctrl.selectedSource = undefined; ctrl.selectedNetwork = undefined; ctrl.selectedSecurityGroup = undefined // // Donut chart // ctrl.donutSettings = { innerRadius: 24, outerRadius: 30, label: { 'font-size': '16px', 'fill': '#1f83c6' }, title: { 'font-size': '10px' } }; $scope.$watch( function () { return $scope.ctrl.newInstanceSpec.instance_count; }, function (newValue, oldValue) { var ctrl = $scope.ctrl; ctrl.updateCharts(); } ); // Reset selected source if the source type is changed $scope.$watch(function(scope) { return $scope.ctrl.newInstanceSpec.source_type; }, function(newValue, oldValue, scope) { var ctrl = scope.ctrl; ctrl.newInstanceSpec.source = undefined; }); $scope.$watch(function (scope) { return $scope.ctrl.model.novaLimits; }, function (newValue, oldValue, scope) { var ctrl = scope.ctrl; ctrl.updateCharts(); }, true); $scope.$watch(function (scope) { return $scope.ctrl.model.newInstanceSpec.flavor; }, function (newValue, oldValue, scope) { var ctrl = scope.ctrl; ctrl.updateCharts(); }, true); // Convenience function to return a sensible value instead of // undefined ctrl.defaultIfUndefined = function (value, defaultValue) { return (value === undefined) ? defaultValue : value; }; ctrl.networksAvailable = function () { return ctrl.model.networks && ctrl.model.networks.length > 0; } ctrl.securityGroupsAvailable = function () { return ctrl.model.securityGroups && ctrl.model.securityGroups.length > 0; } ctrl.multipleSelectedNetworks = function () { return ctrl.newInstanceSpec.networks.length > 1; } ctrl.multipleSelectedSecurityGroups = function () { return ctrl.newInstanceSpec.security_groups.length > 1; } ctrl.updateSelectedSource = function() { //ctrl.newInstanceSpec.source.length = 0; //ctrl.newInstanceSpec.source.push(source); } ctrl.updateSelectedNetwork = function() { // TODO - Can't interfere with network details // ctrl.newInstanceSpec.networks.length = 0; // selectedNetwork set by ng-model //ctrl.newInstanceSpec.networks.push(ctrl.selectedNetwork); } ctrl.updateSelectedSecurityGroup = function(){ // TODO - Can't interfere with security group details //ctrl.newInstanceSpec.security_groups.lenth = 0; // selectedSecurityGroup set by ng-model //ctrl.newInstanceSpec.security_groups.push(ctrl.selectedSecurityGroup); } ctrl.updateCharts = function() { var ctrl = this; ctrl.instancesChartData = ctrl.getChartData( ctrl.chartTotalInstancesLabel, ctrl.newInstanceSpec.instance_count, ctrl.model.novaLimits.totalInstancesUsed, ctrl.model.novaLimits.maxTotalInstances); var selectedVcpus = ctrl.newInstanceSpec.flavor ? ctrl.newInstanceSpec.flavor.vcpus : 0; ctrl.vcpusChartData = ctrl.getChartData( ctrl.chartTotalVcpusLabel, ctrl.newInstanceSpec.instance_count * selectedVcpus, ctrl.model.novaLimits.totalCoresUsed, ctrl.model.novaLimits.maxTotalCores); var selectedRam = ctrl.newInstanceSpec.flavor ? ctrl.newInstanceSpec.flavor.ram : 0; ctrl.ramChartData = ctrl.getChartData( ctrl.chartTotalRamLabel, ctrl.newInstanceSpec.instance_count * selectedRam, ctrl.model.novaLimits.totalRAMUsed, ctrl.model.novaLimits.maxTotalRAMSize); } ctrl.getChartData = function(title, added, totalUsed, maxAllowed) { var used = this.defaultIfUndefined(totalUsed, 0); var allowed = this.defaultIfUndefined(maxAllowed, 1); var usageData = { label: gettext('Current Usage'), value: used, color: '#1f83c6' }; var addedData = { label: gettext('Added'), value: added, color: '#81c1e7' }; var remainingData = { label: gettext('Remaining'), value: Math.max(0, allowed - used - added), color: '#d1d3d4' }; var chartData = { title: title, label: Math.ceil((used + added) / allowed * 100) + '%', data: [usageData, addedData, remainingData] }; return chartData; }; ctrl.updateCharts(); } function LaunchInstanceDetailsHelpCtrl() { this.title = gettext('Instance Details Help'); this.paragraphs = [ gettext('An instance name is required and used to help you uniquely identify your instance in the dashboard.'), gettext('If you select an availability zone and plan to use the boot from volume option, make sure that the availability zone you select for the instance is the same availability zone where your bootable volume resides.') ]; } })();

commit_message:
Updated tab_locator in menus &'submit' method in forms

In forms.py:
	In class TabbedFormRegion:
	* Added submit method for tabbed for forms
In menus.py:
    In TabbedMenuRegion:
	* changed the _tab_locator to (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'li > a')
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1431465

Change-Id: Ifc273cdc730963f5ed97a016c8cfbbdef4495859

commit_message:
Add vertica cluster support

   - Cluster launch with topology view and inital admin user/password customized.
   - Reset admin user/password for cluster access
   - Cluster termination

Change-Id: I1b4ffbd48bfe1326e0848e4ef9c7808c71a909c7
Co-author: Michael Yu <michayu@ebaysf.com>

commit_message:
Using a one 'statistics_list' for all resources

Currently, in 'metering' dashboard we use a 'statistics_list' request
for every resource which we want to look. It bulks a ceilometer-api
aspecially at huge amount of samples. Otherwise, we can use one statistics
request and split result in CeilometerUsage, because statistics_list supports
a groupby parameter.

Change-Id: I4f8436223fd3f3a786a2a42a219f892a4fc69bbe

commit_message:
Integration test - Setup TestCase for multi user env

Every test case run as a unique user which is
created by admin during the test case setup.
Multiple suite of integration tests can be
executed against a single devstack instance
concurrently

Closes-Bug: #1406128
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Partially implements blueprint: multi-user-concurrent-test

Change-Id: I331ce343b565647090787a557f75ddac284f1cd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/21/147721/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid TEST_USER_NAME = "user_" + str(uuid.uuid4()) self.home_pg = self.login_pg.login( user=self.conf.identity.admin_username, password=self.conf.identity.admin_password) self.users_page = self.home_pg.go_to_identity_userspage() email = self.TEST_USER_NAME + "@os.com" password = self.conf.identity.password self.users_page.create_user(self.TEST_USER_NAME, email, password, password, 'demo', '_member_') self.home_pg.go_to_home_page() self.home_pg.log_out() self.home_pg = self.login_pg.login(self.TEST_USER_NAME, self.conf.identity.password) self.home_pg = self.login_pg.login( user=self.conf.identity.admin_username, password=self.conf.identity.admin_password) self.users_page = self.home_pg.go_to_identity_userspage() self.users_page.delete_user(self.TEST_USER_NAME) self.home_pg.go_to_home_page() self.home_pg.log_out()

Storage usage values in Create Volume / Extend Volume / Create
Volume Snapshot modals does not include storage used by volume
snapshots. This patch fixes the issue by adding snapshots
storage usage in the reported value.

Change-Id: I4dc14b7d08d58db2a00124f44e80ebdb329d4a82
Closes-Bug: #1283281'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-01-22 00:55:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/c2ecb23f8d5ef056cf3e3d537411acc53a49fc11', 'message': "Use Cinder limit API for used quota

As we currently calculate Cinder quota manually in Horizon there's no
way to account for the Cinder setting that specifies whether to include
snapshot storage in the used gigabytes count for quota calculation.

This change removes the manual calculation of Cinder quotas and uses the
response from the Cinder limits API, which has been around since Icehouse.

See Cinder commits:
  - 8aa8ebc0a0d0f459e9293f9ff5a5f8358fd01b9a and
  - c9c6befe7e19adc168aefe1cfaeac8d68dd398fa

Closes-Bug: #1283281
Co-Authored-By: Vahid Hashemian <vahidhashemian@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I4dc14b7d08d58db2a00124f44e80ebdb329d4a82
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-01-22 04:50:16.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/templates/volumes/volumes/_limits.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/templates/volumes/volumes/_snapshot_limits.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/snapshots/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/volumes/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/volumes/forms.py', 'openstack_dashboard/usage/quotas.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/templates/volumes/volumes/_extend_limits.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/volumes/views.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/604ece5612ec6070f77c5b734ab58f526566b53f', 'message': "Use Cinder limit API for used quota

commit_message:
Use Cinder limit API for used quota

As we currently calculate Cinder quota manually in Horizon there's no
way to account for the Cinder setting that specifies whether to include
snapshot storage in the used gigabytes count for quota calculation.

This change removes the manual calculation of Cinder quotas and uses the
response from the Cinder limits API, which has been around since Icehouse.

See Cinder commits:
  - 8aa8ebc0a0d0f459e9293f9ff5a5f8358fd01b9a and
  - c9c6befe7e19adc168aefe1cfaeac8d68dd398fa

Closes-Bug: #1283281
Co-Authored-By: Vahid Hashemian <vahidhashemian@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I4dc14b7d08d58db2a00124f44e80ebdb329d4a82

commit_message:
Clear all button if there is more than one error alert

Testing scenario for producing > 1 error (thanks tqtran!):
For Launch Instance, set Instance Count to 4+ and
set Flavor Size to m1.xlarge

Change-Id: Ia623a7a0f781feaf3b6d14e72ebe3a2e36854117
Closes-Bug: #1334340

commit_message:
Adds auto fade-out for AJAX messages (a new setting)

Before, auto fade-out was enabled only for non-AJAX messages,
because fade-out function was subscribed only on "DOM ready" event
(with jQuery .ready(...) method). It fires only after initial DOM
load and it is not working when DOM is modified later.

This patch subscribes fade-out function to an event that corresponds
to moment when AJAX message is shown if the `auto_fade_alerts.mode` is
set to 'ajax' or 'both' (a new setting).

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1442288
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I03be3bed878102702651dfa36007f83974d1b8fd

commit_message:
Fix popover positions in network topology

Router popovers are now positioned correctly next to
router representation in Firefox and IE. If popover
overflows window to the right and enough room is on
the left, display balloon to the left of device.

Change-Id: I10ae9ace84605adde3be760aae0418266d3c261d
Closes-Bug: #1403216

commit_message:
Feature Toggles

Work in Progress...

A patch that allows for features to be toggled on and off based on local_settings.py.

A feature that is off can (presumably) be committed while in prototype state, allowing
for easier incremental development. A feature should not be enabled by default (toggle
removed) until the feature is production ready.

Change-Id: I3fcf426a4f09bed304982d6969af050f7f15c096

commit_message:
WIP Angular Users Panel settings-dependent features

Settings used: API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE, OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE

To test it out, add the following to local_settings.py:

REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS = ['API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE',
'OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE']

Restart server.

Change-Id: Ia87744d74ddb374a2820423098383d3e7cb851cd

commit_message:
WIP Angular Users Panel - Admin Password check

This is a settings-dependent feature.

To test it out, add the following to local_settings.py:
REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS = ['ENFORCE_PASSWORD_CHECK']
Restart server.

Then when you click on "Change Password", you should see
an additional required field that will ask for the
logged-in admin's password.

Change-Id: Icec097eb40958c3aba5dbc36ede40b83fab8749d

commit_message:
reuse a working firefox profile

Currently,Integration test always created a new Firefox
profile to launch Firefox at default. this new temporary
profile will be failed in corporate network environment.

FIREFOX_PROFILE=/horizon/.mozilla/firefox/horizon.default
then export to reuse it

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1450289

Change-Id: Ifd150dde983fba6e1319351305d55b1db699cd6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/24/178924/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; describe('Identity roles table controller', function() { var fakePromise = function(){ return { success: function(){} }; }; var policy = { allowed: true }; var fakePolicy = function(){ return { success: function(callback){ callback(policy); } }; }; var controller, scope, policyAPI, keystoneAPI; beforeEach(module('hz')); beforeEach(module('hz.dashboard')); beforeEach(module('hz.dashboard.identity.roles')); beforeEach(inject(function($injector){ policyAPI = $injector.get('policyAPI'); spyOn(policyAPI, 'check').and.callFake(fakePolicy); keystoneAPI = $injector.get('keystoneAPI'); spyOn(keystoneAPI, 'getRoles').and.callFake(fakePromise); controller = $injector.get('$controller'); })); function createController(){ scope = {}; controller('identityRolesCtrl', { $scope: scope, policyAPI: policyAPI, keystoneAPI: keystoneAPI, }); } it('should invoke keystone getRoles if policy passes', function(){ policy.allowed = true; createController(); expect(policyAPI.check).toHaveBeenCalled(); expect(keystoneAPI.getRoles).toHaveBeenCalled(); }); it('should not invoke keystone getRoles if policy fails', function(){ policy.allowed = false; horizon.alert = function(){}; createController(); expect(policyAPI.check).toHaveBeenCalled(); expect(keystoneAPI.getRoles).not.toHaveBeenCalled(); }); }); })();

commit_message:
Made changes per doc conventions to multiple rst
files.

changed file to comply with official doc conventions
horizon should be lowercase per the official name
and capitalization section in the wiki
documentation conventions for OpenStack
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Conventions
Partial-bug: 1446253

Change-Id: Iecd043176fdc6c5fb972b6b7f85a7800ac092938

commit_message:
Add Volume Backend Name to Create Volume Type

This patch combines the steps to set up volume backend name for a
volume type into the volume type creation process by adding the new
"Volume Backend Name" choice field to the Create Volume Type dialog.

Change-Id: I1547adacb2c8f50196e9e7c6f93222a428a0b024
Implements: blueprint volume-type-set-backend-name
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/02/132902/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class CreateVolumeType(forms.SelfHandlingForm): volume_type_name = forms.CharField(max_length=255, label=_("Name")) volume_backend_name = forms.MultipleChoiceField( label=_("Volume Backend Name"), required=False) def __init__(self, request, *args, **kwargs): super(CreateVolumeType, self).__init__(request, *args, **kwargs) backend_name_field = self.fields['volume_backend_name'] backend_name_field.choices = self.get_backend_names() def get_backend_names(self): backend_names = self.initial['backend_names'] backend_name_list = [(backend['name'], backend['name']) for backend in backend_names] return backend_name_list def format_backend_names(self, backend_names): # convert list of names to a comma separated string names = ','.join(backend_names) return names def set_extra_spec(self, request, volume_type_id, names): try: cinder.volume_type_extra_set(request, volume_type_id, {'volume_backend_name': names}) return True except Exception: return False def handle(self, request, data): try: volume_type = cinder.volume_type_create(request, data['volume_type_name']) if data['volume_backend_name']: backend_names = self.format_backend_names( data['volume_backend_name']) extra_spec = self.set_extra_spec(request, volume_type.id, backend_names) if extra_spec: messages.success(request, _('Successfully created volume type "%s"' ' with the specified volume backend' ' name(s).') % data['volume_type_name']) return volume_type else: messages.warning(request, _('Successfully created volume type "%s"' ', but unable to create an extra spec' ' for the specified volume backend' ' name(s).') % data['volume_type_name']) return volume_type else: messages.success(request, _('Successfully created volume type "%s".') % data['volume_type_name']) return volume_type except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to create volume type.')) return False

commit_message:
fix bug - IE9 cuts off css rules

bug link: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1417314

IE9 has limit on the number of css rules can be parsed in a single css file.
The limit is 4095 = (4k - 1). This causes the new css rules for angular-
based widget styled improperly.

This change moves the new css code for angular-based widgets
to another css file and keep the remaining page styling untouched.

Link:
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ieinternals/archive/2011/05/14/10164546.aspx

Change-Id: I9e689cb23835e6b1354e6c05506de5fbb4ed965c

commit_message:
Adding new util: next unique ID

There are some places we want to use ID in the UI. A hard-coded value
cannot be guaranteed to be unique.  This change provides a utility
function to get the next unique ID.

Applied to Launch Instance wizard form fields.

Change-Id: I35bb7c3225ba811526955816ad6655e3aaae9ed6
Closes-Bug: #1453260
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/06/177506/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /** * get next unique ID * @return {Number} * * @example ```js var id = hzUtils.nextUid(); // or $scope.id = 'id_' + hzUtils.nextUid(); ``` */ nextUid: (function () { var uid = 0; return function () { return uid++; }; })() }());

commit_message:
Port and Port-Range fields' asterisk missing in Access-Security tab

The 'Port', 'From Port' and 'To Port' are the required fields for
managing rules in Access and Security tab, but do not have the
asterisk marked against them. To replicate this, please follow
Projects -> Access and Security -> Add/Edit Rules (on any security
group that has been created).

Change-Id: Ic18963a75040c99d9fc5b30a487368fbde305225
Closes-Bug: 1292165

commit_message:
Adds asterisk symbol for image location

This patch adds the required asterisk symbol to Image Location or
Image File field depending on the "Image Source" selection on the
Create Image form.

Change-Id: I7c3888eff6ac200c41b29f2e46d9993a5c365a04
Closes-bug: #1292103

commit_message:
LoadBalancers' Add Member form has missing asterisk for 'Members' list

Under Load Balancers section, while adding a new Member to the pool,
if the 'Member Source' is selected as 'Active instances', a 'Members'
multiple-select field comes up. Here atleast 1 member must be
selected to submit the form. Hence, this field should be marked with
an asterisk.

Closes-Bug: #1396983
Closes-Bug: #1392182

commit_message:
WIP re-design of top-level Horizon menu

Reverted project context selection so that it would work. Styling is
still a mess due to ul li style bleed through.

Fixed menu content for project, identity and admin

Latest update:

- masthead
- activate some links for demo
- move tab labels up
- project dropdown fixed
- masthead style tweaks
- menu items now stacked for smaller widths
- tweaks to menu style
- added region picker
- needs to be context-aware (admin vs. user, actual menu items enabled)
- many little style tweaks

Change-Id: I05aa2b03d21377a2998c7c4da8ba043a823c62e7

commit_message:
Unit test for the exponentially growing AJAX fix

The original fix of exponentially growing AJAX updates for table rows
is reviewed at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113855/ Provide unit
test for the bug regression with $.ajax and timeouts being mocked out.

Related-Bug: #1263665
Change-Id: I6f6d1a7d8a6a61aee3620a0eb96ecb1522c865d2

commit_message:
Updated error message when image creation fails

Initially if image creation fails, the message that is displayed
provides insufficient details for the exception. With this fix,
more clear error message will be displayed to the user.

Change-Id: I4973090e845d9be8cdc1449423b537dda32dfade
Closes-Bug: #1261755
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/26/143026/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception as e: if e.code == 413: exceptions.handle(request, _('Denying attempt to upload image \ because it exceeds the quota')) else: exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to create new image.'))
deleted_lines: except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to create new image.'))

commit_message:
Co-locate common test infrastructure

This patch provides a "test-framework" directory and
a "spec_framework" array in jasmine_tests.py to collect
test code needed by multiple different jasmine test files.

Similar to angular-mocks.js, when test code depends on some
common test-only code, it is nice to have that in one place
and included separately (and before) any of the spec files
get included.

Change-Id: Ie614e492eb5036e21f06bf8458fb3f6f6af0657c

commit_message:
Store cookies using UID

This patch also adds a cookie / user to coordinate with bug 1363188

Partial-Bug: #1363188

Change-Id: Ie285f38764a7652483e95185da3e1fe4d17607ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/40/133540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Cisco Systems, Inc.import json import loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class UserCookieStore(dict): """This class provided a method to store cookies on a per user basis It stores all the items needed in a single cookie with the name of the userid. Then all the specific names and values for that user are encoded to a json string. """ def __init__(self, request, response=None, user_id=None): self.request = request self.response = response if user_id: self.userid = user_id else: self.userid = getattr(request.user, 'id') try: data = json.loads(self.request.COOKIES.get(self.userid, "")) except (TypeError, ValueError): data = {} super(UserCookieStore, self).__init__(data) def __setitem__(self, name, item): if self.response: super(UserCookieStore, self).__setitem__(name, item) self.response.set_cookie(self.userid, json.dumps(self)) else: raise TypeError('Without a response object this entry is readonly') def default_services_region(request, user_id, service_catalog): """Returns the first endpoint region for first non-identity service. Extracted from the service catalog. """ if service_catalog: available_regions = [endpoint['region'] for service in service_catalog for endpoint in service['endpoints'] if service['type'] != 'identity'] if not available_regions: # this is very likely an incomplete keystone setup LOG.warning('No regions could be found excluding identity.') available_regions = [endpoint['region'] for service in service_catalog for endpoint in service['endpoints']] if not available_regions: # this is a critical problem and it's not clear how this occurs LOG.error('No regions can be found in the service catalog.') return None user_cookies = UserCookieStore(request, user_id=user_id) selected_region = user_cookies.get('services_region', available_regions[0]) if selected_region not in available_regions: selected_region = available_regions[0] return selected_region return None

commit_message:
Refactor project instance test

Refactoring the test_launch_instance_post test as suggested in
review for bug 1260436. There are four distinct other users of
test_launch_instance_post apart from the test itself.

Creating a new method _test_launch_instance_post and ensuring
test_launch_instance_post now invokes this method with the
default and only required parameters. Other tests also invoke the
new method with parameters specific to them.

Additionally, there other launch_instance_post tests with boot
from volume that could also use this common method.
These changes have also been made.

Closes bug: #1403948

Change-Id: I5d2272a0abb521ddb9b1df215d45655a9049d0e0

commit_message:
JSCS - Demo patch for error filter

This file demonstrates adding several kinds of line too long
errors, and proves that they are ignored by jscs.

They also add some examples of lines that are STILL errors
because they aren't an exact match for the filter

To test:
jscs horizon/static/framework/jscs_error_tests.spec.js
jscs horizon/static/framework/jscs_error_tests.js

To see the errors again, change jscs_error_filter.js to return
immediately

Change-Id: Ib5f515b8995b51d960f70c5116a4198b7604c552

commit_message:
Fixes the sort in Flavor table

This patch makes sorted by RAM as default in the Flavor table in the
Flavor Panel. Also the sort is now customizable.

Change-Id: Ib2859684b05311b1470bd61229071a573c3db802
Closes-bug: #1433317
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/00/165800/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: flavors.sort(key=lambda f: (f.ram, f.disk, f.vcpus))

commit_message:
Add py34 env

Adds a new py34 environment in tox.ini which builds off of separate
(test-)requirements-py3.txt
resolved some of syntax and import errors

Partial-Implements: blueprint porting-python3
Change-Id: Ibf07e0cd26a8b5f4c38ce1d92612919e34693d04

commit_message:
Integration tests - Object store

Implemented page for testing basic operations with containers.
Scenario:
  * create new container
  * check if is present in the list
  * remove the container

Object store service shoudn't be installed by default, so there was also
added option to horizon.conf for enable/disable these subset of tests.

Partially implements blueprint: integration-tests-object-store
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I6ad1267c10d32f14a29f245d00d95da95d353dc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/87/151187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests import helpers class TestObjectStore(helpers.TestCase): """ Object store (swift service) integration tests """ def test_create_delete_container(self): """ Scenario: * log in as regular user * create new container * check if was created (present in list) * remove the container """ object_page = self.home_pg.go_to_objectstore_containerspage() name = str(uuid.uuid4()) object_page.create_container(name) self.assertTrue(object_page.is_container_present(name)) # TODO: remove whole content (objects inside) before deleting container object_page.delete_container(name)

commit_message:
WIP: Converting horizon JS to use use i18n library

This is the first in a series of dependent patches that
wean Angular away from global gettext references in favor
of an injectable service.

This first patch removes the use of gettext references in
constants (which can't take advantage of an injected
'gettext' service.

TODO: Check for other constants that use gettext
TODO: Test that strings still appear correctly in UI
TODO: Create next dependent patch that uses injected gettext
      in normal code.

Co-Authored-By: Tyr Johanson <tyr@hp.com>
Change-Id: I3a76b90e1c3e889387597e8a296d8efb0f2e2367
Partial-Bug: 1446739

commit_message:
fixed row update of firewall table

In firewall table, after creating a
firewall the row should be updated
whenever the status of the firewall
changes. but it is not and it get
struck in the pending_create status.

It needs page reload to update the row.

In this patch, the added Update row class
will reload a row after the status change.

Change-Id: I1558722618cdeed016ae28c773a36c4a928b3a23
closes-Bug: #1424571

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Adding launch details step

Address changes in UX design:
- Create a separate instance-details step in Launch Instance work flow.
- Make it the first step in the work flow.

Change-Id: Ifbb3f1e69f214c51cb638eb05ba889496d565bbc
Closes-Bug: 1434700
