commit_message:
make_xstatic_setup_cfg.py initial commit

Our xstatic repos aren't auto-uploading to pypi as they should be
because their build process isn't matching the old standard way.

Now, pbr requires a more boiler-plate setup.py and a not-boiler-plate
setup.cfg file.  This setup.cfg file will need to be re-made each and
every time any of the xstatic packages are updated.  Thus, I've made a
tool to remake that setup.cfg file whenever necessary.

An example of the setup.cfg file being added can be found here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204283/

Change-Id: I1950bd366f9a531ec2916a0942cbc32d683d8072
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/76/204376/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
#!/usr/bin/env python """A script to generate the setup.cfg file for the various xstatic repos used by openstack horizon. Each time an xstatic repo is updated, this script will need to be run against that repo's directory. """ import argparse import ConfigParser import importlib import os import re import StringIO import sys OUT_FILE_NAME = 'setup.cfg' SCRIPT_NAME = os.path.basename(os.path.realpath(__file__)) HELP_COMMENT = """# This config file has been created by # <horizon home>/tools/%s """ % SCRIPT_NAME XSTATIC_PKG_DIR = os.path.join('xstatic', 'pkg') def import_xstatic_package(): """Normally, one would just: from xstatic.pkg import jasmine as xs but this needs to support repos other than just jasmine, so the import is somewhat complicated. """ dir_list = [d for d in os.listdir(XSTATIC_PKG_DIR) if os.path.isdir(os.path.join(XSTATIC_PKG_DIR, d))] if len(dir_list) != 1: raise OSError('Can not determine xstatic package name. ' 'Are you in the correct directory?') xs_name = dir_list[0] sys.path.insert(0, '.') return importlib.import_module('xstatic.pkg.' + xs_name) def write_data(): """Generates the text of the setup.cfg file.""" config = ConfigParser.SafeConfigParser() xs = import_xstatic_package() # METADATA Section config.add_section('metadata') config.set('metadata', 'name', xs.PACKAGE_NAME) # pbr doesn't seem to play well with the version value. #config.set('metadata', 'version', xs.PACKAGE_VERSION) config.set('metadata', 'summary', xs.DESCRIPTION) config.set('metadata', 'description-file', 'README.txt') # Is this right? config.set('metadata', 'author', xs.MAINTAINER) config.set('metadata', 'author-email', xs.MAINTAINER_EMAIL) config.set('metadata', 'home-page', xs.HOMEPAGE) if xs.CLASSIFIERS: config.set('metadata', 'classifier', '
' + '
'.join(xs.CLASSIFIERS)) # FILES Section # These never change for any xstatic package. config.add_section('files') config.set('files', 'packages', 'xstatic') config.set('files', 'namespace_packages', '
xstatic
xstatic.pkg') config_file = StringIO.StringIO() config.write(config_file) return config_file.getvalue() def clean_white_space(cfg_contents): # Replace tabs with 4 spaces. cfg_contents = cfg_contents.replace('	', ' ') # Clean trailing spaces. cfg_contents = re.sub(r'(?m) $', '', cfg_contents) return cfg_contents def xstatic_repo(dir_str): """Validates that dir_str appears to be a valid xstatic repo directory.""" if not os.path.isdir(dir_str): err_msg = '%s is not a directory, much less a valid xstatic repo.' err_msg %= dir_str raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(err_msg) if not os.path.isdir(os.path.join(dir_str, XSTATIC_PKG_DIR)): err_msg = '%s does not appear to be a valid xstatic repo.' % dir_str raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(err_msg) return dir_str if __name__ == '__main__': parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description=__doc__) parser.add_argument('directory', type=xstatic_repo, default='.', nargs='?', help='directory of the xstatic repo') args = parser.parse_args() os.chdir(args.directory) contents = write_data() contents = clean_white_space(contents) with file(OUT_FILE_NAME, 'w') as fh: fh.write(HELP_COMMENT) fh.write(contents)

commit_message:
Make tests pass with random PYTHONHASHSEED

Some of the API tests relied on specific order of keys used in
serialization. This order would change, if PYTHONHASHSEED changed,
therefore the tests would fail.

This change improves this situation, by comparing json/html and not
relying on their string representation, where relevant.

Also makes order of calls to in _update_project_members predictable, by
sorting the keys of a defaultdict, returned by api.keystone.get_project_users_roles

Finally this change ignores some of the checks for django 1.4, that may
fail due to an incorrect behaviour of django test.html parser

The change removes PYTHONHASHSEED=0 requirement from tox.ini

Closes-Bug: #1348818
Change-Id: I09c6be62f7bfc5709ea48c55e5412cf0850e8fc8

commit_message:
LBaas v1 Associate Monitor to Pool Fails

The associate monitor fails to show monitors to choose from
within horizon.  The monitor list code has changed where
you can no longer list monitors with a filter criteria.
This change switches to grab needed monitors one at a time.

commit_message:
Removing Network Profile support in stable/kilo

Network profile is not supported in stable/kilo by the Cisco N1KV
ML2 driver. As the patch for enabling/disabling network profile
support based on a configurable parameter was rejected, this patch
pulls out the network profile code completly from stable/kilo.

This patch is necessary for horizon to be functional with Cisco
N1KV ML2 driver.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/router/nexus1000v/tests.py

Change-Id: I1ef2f489c9bb2adfbe3174c3667539c59562966f
Closes-bug: #1475190
(cherry picked from commit d29a68c4f3fa81fa8b3aa19e0de71b69ba9cb015)

commit_message:
Throw a warning message when failed to get pool detail

When subnet associated to a pool deleted, the pool detail page will
throw an exception. Fix the problem by showing a warning message
when failed to get the expand resources for the pool.

Change-Id: I9f853505db625527de69c8f620b988e6e42a4339
Related-bug: #1406879
(cherry picked from commit 8c4b0830a87f511687a9ecc568aa707dfdb343d9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/92/174392/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _ from horizon import messages messages.warning(request, _("Unable to get VIP for pool " "%(pool)s.") % {"pool": pool["id"]}) try: pool = neutronclient(request).show_pool(pool_id).get('pool') except Exception: messages.warning(request, _("Unable to get pool detail.")) return None if expand_resource: # TODO(lyj): The expand resource(subnet, member etc.) attached # to a pool could be deleted without cleanup pool related database, # this will cause exceptions if we trying to get the deleted resources. # so we need to handle the situation by showing a warning message here. # we can safely remove the try/except once the neutron bug is fixed # https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1406854 try: pool['subnet'] = neutron.subnet_get(request, pool['subnet_id']) except Exception: messages.warning(request, _("Unable to get subnet for pool " "%(pool)s.") % {"pool": pool_id}) try: pool['members'] = _member_list(request, expand_pool=False, pool_id=pool_id) except Exception: messages.warning(request, _("Unable to get members for pool " "%(pool)s.") % {"pool": pool_id}) try: pool['health_monitors'] = pool_health_monitor_list( request, id=pool['health_monitors']) except Exception: messages.warning(request, _("Unable to get health monitors " "for pool %(pool)s.") % {"pool": pool_id})
deleted_lines: pool = neutronclient(request).show_pool(pool_id).get('pool') if expand_resource: pool['subnet'] = neutron.subnet_get(request, pool['subnet_id']) pool['members'] = _member_list(request, expand_pool=False, pool_id=pool_id) pool['health_monitors'] = pool_health_monitor_list( request, id=pool['health_monitors'])

Implementing RBAC in Admin Dashboard

Placing permissions on panels for the specific 
rules that controls each operation.

blueprint admin-rbac

}

REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS = ['OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES']
OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES = {
    'can_set_password': True
}

Change can_set_password to False to see it not show up.

Must restart the server.

Change-Id: Id17c54c92c9d160c9a3df2b153134d348c13dff5
Closes-Bug: #1439905

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Show Admin Password

We need to show admin password if enabled for the hypervisor type.

Note: To test, you need to add the following to local_settings.py
REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS = ['OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES']
OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES = {
    'can_set_password': True
}

Change can_set_password to False to see it not show up.

Must restart the server.

Change-Id: Id17c54c92c9d160c9a3df2b153134d348c13dff5
Closes-Bug: #1439905
Co-Authored-By: Travis Tripp <travis.tripp@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully  <brian.tully@hp.com>

commit_message:
Expose Image owner info in the image table

Currently Image table does not show the owner information,
Code has been implemented which will add a new column in the
Image table to display the owner information.

implements bp expose-image-owner-info

Change-Id: I49be6081bdbdc94011c1fc58d3def3eb24094d47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/71/142671/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_owner_info(image): owner = getattr(image, "owner", "") return owner owner_info = tables.Column(get_owner_info, verbose_name=_("Owner Id"))

commit_message:
Demo for Pie/Donut Chart Directive

This patch is a demo of the pie/donut chart directive using
fake data. Hover over a slice to see tooltip.

To view: http://localhost:9000/admin/hypervisors

This patch should NOT be merged.

Change-Id: I848969af4a8b22aa5ec99067c0dbb47273bf2f42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/60/154160/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (function() { 'use strict'; angular .module('hz.admin.hypervisors', []) .controller('hzAdminHypervisorsCtrl', [ '$scope', '$http', hzAdminHypervisorsCtrl ]); function hzAdminHypervisorsCtrl($scope, $http) { $scope.disk = { title: 'Local Disk Usage (GB)', data: [ { label: 'Current', slice: 5 }, { label: 'Applied', slice: 5 }, { label: 'Available', slice: 10, showKey: false } ], colors: [ '#1f83c6', '#81c1e7', '#d1d3d4' ], text: '50%' }; $scope.vcpus = { title: 'VCPU Usage', data: [ { label: 'Current', slice: 1 }, { label: 'Applied', slice: 1 }, { label: 'Available', slice: 3, showKey: false } ], colors: [ '#1f83c6', '#81c1e7', '#d1d3d4' ], text: '20%' }; $scope.ram = { title: 'Memory Usage (MB)', data: [ { label: 'Current', slice: 2048 }, { label: 'Applied', slice: 2048 }, { label: 'Available', slice: 10240, showKey: false } ], colors: [ '#1f83c6', '#81c1e7', '#d1d3d4' ], text: '29%' }; $scope.pdisk = { title: 'Local Disk Usage (GB)', data: [ { label: 'Current', slice: 5 }, { label: 'Applied', slice: 5 }, { label: 'Available', slice: 10, showKey: false } ], colors: [ '#1f83c6', '#81c1e7', '#d1d3d4' ] }; $scope.pvcpus = { title: 'VCPU Usage', data: [ { label: 'Current', slice: 1 }, { label: 'Applied', slice: 1 }, { label: 'Available', slice: 3, showKey: false } ], colors: [ '#1f83c6', '#81c1e7', '#d1d3d4' ] }; $scope.pram = { title: 'Memory Usage (MB)', data: [ { label: 'Current', slice: 2048 }, { label: 'Applied', slice: 2048 }, { label: 'Available', slice: 10240, showKey: false } ], colors: [ '#1f83c6', '#81c1e7', '#d1d3d4' ] }; } })();

There are two demos. One showing the ability to allocate only
one item. If an item from the available table is selected,
the allocated item will be swapped out with the new item. The
other demo shows transfer tables with re-ordering and multi
allocation. Drag and drop to re-order the allocated table.

Filtering and sort are enabled on the available table.

Demo only. This patch will NOT be merged.

To test:
Single allocation: http://localhost:9000/identity/users/transfer/
Multi allocation: http://localhost:9000/identity/users/transfer-multi/

commit_message:
Demo for transfer tables

There are two sets of transfer tables on the same page.

One showing the ability to allocate only one item. If an
item from the available table is selected, the allocated
item will be swapped out with the new item. The other one
shows transfer tables with re-ordering and multi allocation.
Drag and drop to re-order the allocated table. Filtering and
sort are enabled on the available table.

Demo only. This patch will NOT be merged.

To test:
http://localhost:9000/identity/users/transfer/

Change-Id: Id514fbcb9f1baf26e9daca55ae490306bff77e25

{% extends 'base.html' %} {% load i18n %} {% block title %}{% trans "Users" %}{% endblock %} {% block page_header %} {% include "horizon/common/_domain_page_header.html" with title=_("Users") %} {% endblock page_header %} {% block main %}

This is a demo of the transfer tables. Only one item can be allocated currently. If an item is selected in the available table, the allocated item will be swapped out.

{% endblock %}

commit_message:
Demo for editable table field directive

Currently showing the ability to select a different flavor, security
group and keypair. When any of the editable fields are clicked, a
select menu appears with the available options (defined in the
controller). When the value is changed, it gets updated in the parent
ngModel

Demo only. This patch will NOT be merged.

Mockup: http://invis.io/8F2185WPR

To test:
Click on the "Editable Demo" link within the UI Sandbox/Angular Widgets
dashboard panel
e.g., http://127.0.0.1:8000/ui_sandbox/

Change-Id: I0582d9ba6cdd1bc4200a911048afb9ce8a2c8c84

This patch introduces a mixin for table views that provides a JSON
endpoint. Currently, only the project instances table is using this.
Once this patch is merged, we will retrofit other tables using the same
pattern. This is done to preserve existing functionality but would also
request for pure data for client rendering.

Basic rendering using angular is already in place.
Things left to consider:
1. table actions
2. row actions
2. styles for actions

Partially-Implements: blueprint table-client-rendering
Change-Id: I55469bcd9158873709de1d19ff2021206737782e

endpoint. This is done to preserve existing functionality, and would
allow the use of client-side rendering. Currently, only project
instances table is using this feature. We can retrofit other tables once
this workflow is solidified and merged.
To view the JSON endpoint: /project/instances/format=json
To view the angular table: /project/instances/angular

Work items remaining:
1. table actions
2. row actions

'}, {'number': 26, 'created': '2014-06-20 22:39:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3259d3e74fb8d8e312f91b2d1a71aaaabb498ec7', 'message': '(WIP) Clientside table rendering

This patch introduces a mixin for table-views that would provide a JSON
endpoint. This is done to preserve existing functionality, and would
shift the bulk of rendering logic to angularJS.

This patch also introduces directives and filters that understands the
json data and knows how to render it. This functionality is tested for
instances table but can be retrofitted to other tables.

To view the JSON endpoint: /project/instances?format=json
To view the old instances page: /project/instances?format=old

Authors: Eric Peterson and Thai Tran
Partially-Implements: blueprint table-client-rendering
Change-Id: I55469bcd9158873709de1d19ff2021206737782e

'}, {'number': 42, 'created': '2014-07-10 07:17:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/a7afd009ca5bc544f02358bf60077296578e974d', 'message': 'Clientside table rendering

This patch introduces a mixin for table-views that would provide a JSON
endpoint. This is done to preserve existing functionality, and would
shift the bulk of rendering to AngularJS.

To take advantage of this feature, follow 2 steps:
1. Inherit the JSONTableMixin (as seen in /project/instances/views.py)
2. Define a data-binding template (as seen in _instances_table.html)
3. Point your table template attribute to your data-binding template

To view the JSON endpoint: /project/instances?format=json
To view the old instances page: /project/instances?format=old

Co-Authored-By: Thai Tran <tqtran@us.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint table-client-rendering
Change-Id: I55469bcd9158873709de1d19ff2021206737782e

To take advantage of this feature, follow 2 steps:
1. Inherit the JSONTableMixin (as seen in /project/instances/views.py)
2. Define a data-binding template (as seen in _instances_table.html)
3. Point your table template attribute to your data-binding template

To view the JSON endpoint: /project/instances?format=json
To view the old instances page: /project/instances?format=old

Co-Authored-By: Thai Tran <tqtran@us.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint table-client-rendering
Change-Id: I55469bcd9158873709de1d19ff2021206737782e

commit_message:
Clientside table rendering

This patch introduces a mixin for table-views that would provide a JSON
endpoint. This is done to preserve existing functionality, and would
shift the bulk of rendering to Javascript in subsequent patches.

To take advantage of this feature, follow 2 steps:
1. Inherit JSONTableMixin in your view class and specify an encoder_class.
2. View the JSON endpoint: /{mytableviewurl}?format=json

Co-Authored-By: Thai Tran <tqtran@us.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint table-client-rendering
Change-Id: I55469bcd9158873709de1d19ff2021206737782e

commit_message:
Enhance Dashboard for Cisco FWaaS

Enhance Network/Firewalls/Firewalls to support additional
attributes (neutron router interface and firewall direction)
which are required by Cisco FWaaS.

"+Create Firewall", "Edit Firewall", and "Firewall Details"
will be enhanced accordingly.

Change-Id: I7fb114ebdda60a94373447b5a29ee1ef20b145bc
Implements: blueprint bp-cisco-fwaas-horizon

commit_message:
Demo for Re-designed Tables

This patch is a demo of the re-designed tables. The table
shows the identity users table. Filtering and check-all are
enabled, but action buttons are dummies only. Reduce the
browser width to see responsiveness in action (lower priority
columns become hidden). Table is sortable (default is email
in reverse order).

To view, browse to:
http://localhost:9000/identity/users/list/

This patch will NOT be merged.

Implemention of patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147393

Change-Id: I89e577453f64da6ad000ab51508d1c55c45da7d4

commit_message:
Add Magic Search to users table

Identity api V3 supports user api filter, V2 does not.  Added
support to detect active identity api version, and user's table
keys off that whether to do client side or api side faceted
filtering.

Depends on following patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/166374/2

Co-Authored-By: David Kavanagh <david.kavanagh@eucalyptus.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aaron Sahlin <asahlin@us.ibm.com>

Partially Implemenents: blueprint filtered-client-side-table

Change-Id: If8a83e76a7a749f0d79400a3db4446e694616131

commit_message:
Updated network name parameter as optional

Previously, while creating a port, network name was mandatory
and was in read only mode. So if a network without name is used
to create port, the port creation fails. This issue has been
resolved by making the network name field as optional.

Added unit test case for the same.

Change-Id: I174e7bf531a93937df5d325711e5160a65409099
Closes-Bug: #1426252

commit_message:
Angularize Identity Users Panel

Sets up the foundation of how tables are written in angular.
Uses the users panel as the starting point.

Link to demo patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177489/

Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Implemenents: blueprint angularize-identity-tables
Change-Id: Iddd81da350c72dfdae6bc10a17fead8c5da181bf

commit_message:
Made changes per doc conventions to
release files

changed files to comply with official doc conventions,
all project names have been lower cased, with following
exception of when the project name is at begining of
the sentence or in the beginging of a header.
changes are made per the official name and capitalization
section in the wiki documentation conventions
for OpenStack
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Conventions
Partial-bug: 1446253

Change-Id: I13a3341158ba5956afc64b091c545298994a9b3d

commit_message:
Add support for Docker image format

The 'Docker' format is added to the default list of supported
formats so it can be selected from the list of formats when creating
or updating an image. When the docker format is selected, the
disk_format and container_format properties are set appropriately.
This also includes changes to the Format column and filter for the
Images table to handle this type.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/forms.py

Closes-Bug: #1455179
Change-Id: Ie705c86d47c0b6035373b9311454748122185988
(cherry picked from commit 12550cb9b9abbd3d7c3e078c5e1e55d7804a733e)

commit_message:
publish docs built from releases repository

We now have the doc build working in the releases repository, and want
to publish the results to docs.openstack.org/releases. This change is
meant to enable that.

Change-Id: Ie7c752ba2ff601e4e0522e0c74ee89e7a23133d5

subject: Add Windows SMB share driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-09 15:41:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/3d3a482d712257183e57cb05e9966003a278a73c', 'message': 'Add Windows SMB share driver

This patch proposes a new share driver, handling Windows service
instances and exporting SMB shares.

WinRM is used for managing the service instances, allowing
password or certificate based authentication.

A new service instance manager is introduced, handling Windows
instances. One requirement is that Cloudbase-Init is present on the
instance.

If AD credentials are provided via security services, the instance
is joined to an AD domain. This can be leveraged in order to set
user based permissions.

Change-Id: Ice5ee63ee4dc2cfcb41567214c165c2705421920
Implements: blueprint windows-smb-support
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-09 16:08:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/7be015da9f1e5b2a0cbc2688941c594b59479ea6', 'message': 'Add Windows SMB share driver

If AD credentials are provided via security services, the instance
is joined to an AD domain. This can be leveraged in order to set

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-10 10:02:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/fac66e0310f475c192b3836872d3070e1a06a288', 'message': '[WIP] Add Windows SMB share driver

This patch proposes a new share driver, handling Windows service
instances and exporting SMB shares.

WinRM is used for managing the service instances, allowing
password or certificate based authentication.

A new service instance manager is introduced, handling Windows
instances. One requirement is that Cloudbase-Init is present on the
instance.

If AD credentials are provided via security services, the instance
is joined to an AD domain. This can be leveraged in order to set
user based permissions.

Unit tests will be included soon. Also, we are working on providing
a CI for this driver. In the absence of it, Tempest results will be
provided. Note that this work will be splitted in multiple patch
sets.

Meanwhile, this is marked as WIP.

Change-Id: Ice5ee63ee4dc2cfcb41567214c165c2705421920
Implements: blueprint windows-smb-support
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-29 13:28:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/7633f315b09c79df70352e9c2b0cfd2da2cf9f63', 'message': '[WIP] Add Windows SMB share driver

This patch proposes a new share driver, handling Windows service
instances and exporting SMB shares.

WinRM is used for managing the service instances, allowing
password or certificate based authentication.

A new service instance manager is introduced, handling Windows
instances. One requirement is that Cloudbase-Init is present on the
instance.

If AD credentials are provided via security services, the instance
is joined to an AD domain. This can be leveraged in order to set
user based permissions.

Unit tests will be included soon. Also, we are working on providing
a CI for this driver. In the absence of it, Tempest results will be
provided. Note that this work will be splitted in multiple patch
sets.

Meanwhile, this is marked as WIP.

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-29 14:49:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/3d416372fa8e3eb42971f02b66f9744771391cf0', 'message': '[WIP] Add Windows SMB share driver

This patch proposes a new share driver, handling Windows service
instances and exporting SMB shares.

WinRM is used for managing the service instances, allowing
password or certificate based authentication.

A new service instance manager is introduced, handling Windows
instances. One requirement is that Cloudbase-Init is present on the
instance.

If AD credentials are provided via security services, the instance
is joined to an AD domain. This can be leveraged in order to set
user based permissions.

Unit tests will be included soon. Also, we are working on providing
a CI for this driver. In the absence of it, Tempest results will be
provided. Note that this work will be splitted in multiple patch
sets.

Meanwhile, this is marked as WIP.

Change-Id: Ice5ee63ee4dc2cfcb41567214c165c2705421920
Implements: blueprint windows-smb-support

commit_message:
Add Windows SMB share driver

This patch proposes a new share driver, handling Windows service
instances and exporting SMB shares.

WinRM is used for managing the service instances, allowing
password or certificate based authentication.

A new service instance manager is introduced, handling Windows
instances. One requirement is that Cloudbase-Init is present on the
instance.

If AD credentials are provided via security services, the instance
is joined to an AD domain. This can be leveraged in order to set
user based permissions.

A CI testing this driver will be up by L-3. Meanwhile, a link to
Tempest results can be found on the blueprint page whiteboard.

Change-Id: Ice5ee63ee4dc2cfcb41567214c165c2705421920
Implements: blueprint windows-smb-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/54/200154/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Cloudbase Solutions SRL # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import re from oslo_concurrency import processutils from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log from manila import exception from manila.i18n import _, _LI, _LW from manila.share.drivers import service_instance from manila.share.drivers.windows import windows_utils from manila.share.drivers.windows import winrm_helper CONF = cfg.CONF LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) windows_share_server_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt( "cert_pem_path", default="~/.ssl/cert.pem", help="Path to the x509 certificate used for accessing the service" "instance."), cfg.StrOpt( "cert_key_pem_path", default="~/.ssl/key.pem", help="Path to the x509 certificate key."), cfg.BoolOpt( "use_cert_based_auth", default=False, help="Use x509 certificates in order to authenticate to the" "service instance.") ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(windows_share_server_opts) class WindowsServiceInstanceManager(service_instance.ServiceInstanceManager): """"Manages Windows Nova instances.""" _INSTANCE_CONNECTION_PROTO = "WinRM" _CBS_INIT_RUN_PLUGIN_AFTER_REBOOT = 2 _CBS_INIT_WINRM_PLUGIN = "ConfigWinRMListenerPlugin" def __init__(self, driver_config=None, remote_execute=None): super(WindowsServiceInstanceManager, self).__init__( driver_config=driver_config) driver_config.append_config_values(windows_share_server_opts) self._use_cert_auth = self.get_config_option("use_cert_based_auth") self._cert_pem_path = self.get_config_option("cert_pem_path") self._cert_key_pem_path = self.get_config_option("cert_key_pem_path") self._check_auth_mode() self._remote_execute = (remote_execute or winrm_helper.WinRMHelper().execute) self._windows_utils = windows_utils.WindowsUtils( remote_execute=self._remote_execute) def _check_auth_mode(self): if self._use_cert_auth: if not (os.path.exists(self._cert_pem_path) and os.path.exists(self._cert_key_pem_path)): msg = _("Certificate based authentication was " "configured one or more certificate is missing.") raise exception.ServiceInstanceException(msg) LOG.debug("Using certificate based authenticaton for " "service instances.") else: instance_password = self.get_config_option( "service_instance_password") if not self._check_password_complexity(instance_password): msg = _("The configured service instance password does not " "match the minimum complexity requirements. " "The password must contain at least one digit, " "one lower case and one upper case character.") raise exception.ServiceInstanceException(msg) LOG.debug("Using password based authentication for " "service instances.") def _get_auth_info(self): auth_info = { 'use_cert_auth': self._use_cert_auth, } if self._use_cert_auth: auth_info.update(cert_pem_path=self._cert_pem_path, cert_key_pem_path=self._cert_key_pem_path) return auth_info def get_common_server(self): data = super(WindowsServiceInstanceManager, self).get_common_server() data['backend_details'].update(self._get_auth_info()) return data def _get_new_instance_details(self, server): instance_details = super(WindowsServiceInstanceManager, self)._get_new_instance_details(server) instance_details.update(self._get_auth_info()) return instance_details def _check_password_complexity(self, password): # Make sure that the Windows complexity requirements are met: # http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc786468(v=ws.10).aspx for r in ["[a-z]", "[A-Z]", "[0-9]"]: if not re.search(r, password): return False return True def _test_server_connection(self, server): try: self._remote_execute(server, "whoami") LOG.debug("Service VM is available via WinRM") return True except Exception as ex: LOG.debug("Server %s is not available via WinRM. Exception: %s ", server['ip'], ex) def _get_service_instance_create_kwargs(self): create_kwargs = {} if self._use_cert_auth: # At the moment, we pass the x509 certificate via user data. # We'll use keypairs instead as soon as the nova client will # support x509 certificates. with open(self._cert_pem_path, 'r') as f: cert_pem_data = f.read() create_kwargs['user_data'] = cert_pem_data else: # The admin password has to be specified via instance metadata in # order to be passed to the instance via the metadata service or # configdrive. admin_pass = self.get_config_option("service_instance_password") create_kwargs['meta'] = {'admin_pass': admin_pass} return create_kwargs def set_up_service_instance(self, context, network_info): instance_details = super(WindowsServiceInstanceManager, self).set_up_service_instance(context, network_info) security_services = network_info['security_services'] security_service = self.get_valid_security_service(security_services) if security_service: self._setup_security_service(instance_details, security_service) instance_details['joined_domain'] = bool(security_service) return instance_details def _setup_security_service(self, server, security_service): domain = security_service['domain'] admin_username = security_service['user'] admin_password = security_service['password'] dns_ip = security_service['dns_ip'] timeout = self.max_time_to_build_instance self._windows_utils.set_dns_client_search_list(server, [domain]) if_index = self._windows_utils.get_interface_index_by_ip(server, server['ip']) self._windows_utils.set_dns_client_server_addresses(server, if_index, [dns_ip]) # Joining an AD domain will alter the WinRM Listener configuration. # Cloudbase-init is required to be running on the Windows service # instance, so we re-enable the plugin configuring the WinRM listener. # In the future, a config option could be added for this, in which case # we could rely on the AD group policies taking care of the WinRM # configuration. self._run_cloudbase_init_plugin_after_reboot( server, plugin_name=self._CBS_INIT_WINRM_PLUGIN) self._windows_utils.join_domain(server, domain, admin_username, admin_password) # We reboot the service instance using the Compute API so that # we can wait for it to become active. self.reboot_server(server, soft_reboot=True) self.wait_for_instance_to_be_active(server['instance_id'], timeout=timeout) if not self._check_server_availability(server): raise exception.ServiceInstanceException( _('%(conn_proto)s connection has not been ' 'established to %(server)s in %(time)ss. Giving up.') % { 'conn_proto': self._INSTNACE_CONNECTION_PROTO, 'server': server['ip'], 'time': self.max_time_to_build_instance}) def get_valid_security_service(self, security_services): if not security_services: LOG.info(_LI("No security services provided.")) elif len(security_services) > 1: LOG.warn(_LW("Multiple security services provided. " "Only one security service is supported.")) else: security_service = security_services[0] security_service_type = security_service['type'] if security_service_type == 'active_directory': return security_service else: LOG.warn(_LW("Only security services of type " "'active_directory' are supported. " "Retrieved security service type: %(sec_type)s"), {'sec_type': security_service_type}) return None def _run_cloudbase_init_plugin_after_reboot(self, server, plugin_name): cbs_init_reg_section = self._get_cbs_init_reg_section(server) plugin_key_path = "%(cbs_init_section)s\\%(instance_id)s\\Plugins" % { 'cbs_init_section': cbs_init_reg_section, 'instance_id': server['instance_id'] } self._windows_utils.set_win_reg_value( server, path=plugin_key_path, key=plugin_name, value=self._CBS_INIT_RUN_PLUGIN_AFTER_REBOOT) def _get_cbs_init_reg_section(self, server): base_path = 'hklm:\\SOFTWARE' cbs_section = 'Cloudbase Solutions\\Cloudbase-Init' upper_sections = ['', 'Wow6432Node'] for upper_section in upper_sections: cbs_init_section = self._windows_utils.normalize_path( os.path.join(base_path, upper_section, cbs_section)) try: self._windows_utils.get_win_reg_value( server, path=cbs_init_section) return cbs_init_section except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as ex: if 'Cannot find path' in ex.stderr: continue else: raise raise exception.ServiceInstanceException( _("Could not retrieve Cloudbase Init registry section"))

commit_message:
rename the opt scheduler_default_filters

The value of "scheduler_default_filters" is what filters are used
by users really and it is not the default one, which makes users
misleading.

Change-Id: I8f589051a30d1585b3656a7d4f384951d3b830b5
DocImpact: rename the CONF.scheduler_default_filters
Closes-Bug:#1449934
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/180910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SCHEDULER_FILTERS_DEFAULT_VALUES = [ 'RetryFilter', 'AvailabilityZoneFilter', 'RamFilter', 'ComputeFilter', 'ComputeCapabilitiesFilter', 'ImagePropertiesFilter', 'ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter', 'ServerGroupAffinityFilter', ] # TODO(zhangtralon): This option has been deprecated in Liberty # in favor of scheduler_filters, which needs to be removed for next version default=SCHEDULER_FILTERS_DEFAULT_VALUES, 'when not specified in the request.' 'DEPRECATED: use the unambiguous scheduler_filters'), cfg.ListOpt('scheduler_filters', default=SCHEDULER_FILTERS_DEFAULT_VALUES, help='Which filter class names to use for filtering hosts ' 'in the request.'), if (CONF.scheduler_default_filters != CONF.scheduler_filters and CONF.scheduler_default_filters != SCHEDULER_FILTERS_DEFAULT_VALUES): LOG.warning(_LW("This scheduler_default_filters has been " "deprecated in Liberty,we don't use it in the " "config file")) return CONF.scheduler_default_filters return CONF.scheduler_filters """Since the operators specify which filters to use we need
deleted_lines: default=[ 'RetryFilter', 'AvailabilityZoneFilter', 'RamFilter', 'ComputeFilter', 'ComputeCapabilitiesFilter', 'ImagePropertiesFilter', 'ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter', 'ServerGroupAffinityFilter', ], 'when not specified in the request.'), return CONF.scheduler_default_filters """Since the caller may specify which filters to use we need

commit_message:
Supporting logging in heat-translator with config file

Added heat-translator-logging.conf
heat-translator.py and osc/v1/translate.py reads configuration file.
Added warning log messages before raising exceptions
To be added proper log messages in the code with other log levels

Partially Implements: blueprint heat-translator-logging

Change-Id: I5aeb39a83dc8dcc59245968d3dd8a6451d93865c

commit_message:
Pass X-Auth-Token into download snapshot request

Since 7.0 the diagnostic snapshow aren't shared by Nginx anymore, and
any request to download goes through Nailgun and therefore requires
authentication token.

Closes-Bug: #1492207

Change-Id: I29e1a5142dd7c7050ba58b68f1161eba339cf53f
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Comment out dl.fedoraproject.org mirror

We are seeing lots of CI failures with 404's in them
today. This comments out the dl.fedoraproject.org
mirror in an attempt to find a mirror that isn't broken.

Related-bug: #1492022

Change-Id: Ic0c63a7b1c525189656272872eaf80d8114d66e2

commit_message:
Setup DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR on fedora slaves

This patch updates Fedora slaves so we use our
distribution mirror on the local jenkins slave as well.

Related-bug: #1492022
Change-Id: I8050ef44db02c4c9f183e37d4e0549d406fe2402
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/23/220523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for FILE in /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora.repo /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora-updates.repo /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora-updates-testing.repo; do sudo sed -e "s|^#baseurl=http://download.fedoraproject.org/pub/fedora/linux|baseurl=$DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR|;/^metalink/d" -i $FILE done

commit_message:
filter_class_names is never passed

Currently,we always use the filters from CONF.scheduler_default_filters.
the filter_class_names parameter in method get_filtered_hosts from class
HostManager is never used. We can removed this parameter safely.

Change-Id: I089fca7e6fa07e4c6e84c39ee9a6e371c763d839
Closes-Bug:#1403020

commit_message:
Support Instances->Disassociate IP action for Neutron setups

When using Neutron-powered networking (vs. Nova-Networks) an instance
can have more than one floating IP assigned to it, but since Horizon
retrieves list of instance's IPs from Nova which doesn't distinguish
between private and floating IPs, it's hard to offer user a choice
which floating IP to disassociate in Instances table.

A different approach is chosen: when the user presses 'Disassociate
IP' button, he is redirected to Access&Security->Floating IPs tab,
where he sees only floating IPs that are linked to the instance which
IP he's disassociating. To make this happen, a hidden FilterAction is
added to Floating IPs table, and the redirect link contains filter
query which is applied once we at Floating IPs table.

Change-Id: Ib91ded75966fc34bf698f77a61299e962bdd6a0b
Closes-Bug: #1226003

commit_message:
Prevent unintentional detaching volume from instance

There is a case that unintentional volume is detached from instance
in terminate instance API.
Because in _shutdown_instance(), all volume block device mapping is
collected and detached by the condition of volume id.
So, if instance has redundant volume block device mapping which made
by attaching failure, terminate instance API detach another volume.
This patch checks consistency of detaching volume and instance
between nova and cinder.

Also this patch moves get_volume_connector() call out of loop
to avoid unnecessary multiple calls.

Co-Authored-By: Haruka Tanizawa <h-tanizawa@intellilink.co.jp>
Change-Id: Ic71c735bf5a6792966ae321c3545f6ad46e932ed
Closes-Bug: #1377161

commit_message:
Move out loading horizon modals to a named function

So it could be called not only on clicking some links, but on the
other events as well, e.g. drag-and-drop.

This change is not currently used by any other horizon/
openstack_dashboard code, it's used only by the murano-dashboard
plugin. So please feel to ignore it :).

Change-Id: Ic17eefb142326c02309b8758166bb9f3c0219164

commit_message:
Pipeline was erroneously overwritten

The pipeline yaml was overwritten with the default value. This
fix it and enable the publishers to send to Monasca.

Also when installing from within VPN the get_url in Ansible
tend to timeout, the script adds a very long timeout to eliminate
the problem.

Also there is now a check to see if the role to be removed from the
monasca-vagrant was alredy removed, in that case it will not try
again. This makes the ceilosca.sh runneable several times without
the need of removing the monasca-vagrant folder. Docs updated.

Change-Id: If09cfc2e1c1a485b1794372f272f86b47ef52079

commit_message:
Add ability to update provider_id during init

During the Liberty release we added the ability to store
a provider_id for a volume in the Cinder database.  This
simplifies a number of things for back ends when accessing
volumes.

One missing piece here however is that we have no way to
populate this data for existing deployments if/when they
upgrade.

This patch provides a simple solution that issues an update
call to the drivers on host init.  It works by fetching a
list of volumes for the specific host, and passes those in
to the driver.  The driver can do nothing, or it can go
through and sync up the Cinder ID's with it's internal
ID's and return the provider update info.

Change-Id: Ib3b078a6f492afada24e534f380f5f014033d603
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/31/215231/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list_of_dicts_to_dict(seq, key): """Convert list of dicts to a indexted dict. Takes a list of dicts, and converts it a nested dict indexed by <key> :param seq: list of dicts :parm key: key in dicts to index by example: lst = [{'id': 1, ...}, {'id': 2, ...}...] key = 'id' returns {1:{'id': 1, ...}, 2:{'id':2, ...} """ return dict((d[key], dict(d, index=i)) for (i, d) in enumerate(seq))

Added root_controller for mariadb datastore

Since both the patches,

are still in review, this new patch depends on both of them
and provides a root_controller for mariadb datastore

commit_message:
VMs fail to start when force_config_drive=Always

When force_config_drive=Always is set, VMs that did not previously
have a config drive created for them will fail to start.

Steps to recreate:
1. Spawn an instance without a config drive
2. Change force_config_drive=True
3. Restart nova-compute
4. Stop the instance
5. Attempt to start the instance

Add function need_make_drive to check the instance config_drive
setting is None, while the config_drive is needed. And remove the
config setting in the disk info when nova compute attempts to start
an instance.

Fixes bug: 1356534

Change-Id: Ia1750bfa9ec096069ed08e7ac96b25a51e42a7b1

subject: neutron port security-group improperly updated on nova interface-attach
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-30 02:15:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9795a3095772c5406e2001d47493cd6630d3c05f', 'message': "neutron port security-group improperly updated on nova interface-attach

With the reference implementation, there exists a problem when using
'nova-interface-attach' using 'net-id' parameter. The neutron port
created for this operation does not inherit the instance's security-groups,
but instead uses just the 'default' security-group.

The fix would be to use the instance's security-groups when the incoming
security-groups parameter is empty.

Change-Id: I59d9a9f3caa5efb49c005bda104eadaf63bc3c8b
Closes-Bug: #1406431
Co-Authored-By: Praveen Yalagandula <ypraveen@avinetworks.com>

With the reference implementation, there exists a problem when using
'nova-interface-attach' using 'net-id' parameter. The neutron port

The proposed fix is to use the instance's security-groups when allocating

raising that error and instead does not use the passed security-groups
when creating a port in such a network.

commit_message:
neutron port security-group improperly updated on nova interface-attach

With the reference implementation, there exists a problem when using
'nova-interface-attach' using 'net-id' parameter. The neutron port
created for this operation does not inherit the instance's security-groups,
but instead uses just the 'default' security-group.

The proposed fix is to use the instance's security-groups when allocating
port for the instance.

However, if port-security extension is present and port-security-enabled
is set to False for the network on which we are trying to attach interface,
then the code had a check to raise an error. This patch removes the code
raising that error and instead does not use the passed security-groups
when creating a port in such a network.

Change-Id: I59d9a9f3caa5efb49c005bda104eadaf63bc3c8b
Closes-Bug: #1406431
Co-Authored-By: Praveen Yalagandula <ypraveen@avinetworks.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/98/144398/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not security_groups: instance_sglist = self.security_group_api.get_instance_security_groups(context, instance['uuid']) security_groups = [i['name'] for i in instance_sglist]

added_lines: =========================An SQL injection attack consists of insertion or "injection" of a SQL query via the input data given to an application, it is a very common attack vector. This plugin test looks for string that resemble SLQ statements that are involved in some form of string building operation. For example - "SELECT %s FROM derp;" % var - "SELECT thing FROM " + tab - "SELECT " + val + " FROM " + tab + ... Unless care is taken to sanitize and control the input data when building such SQL statement strings, an injection attack becomes possible. If strings of this nature are discovered a LOW confidence issue is reported. In order to boost result confidence, this plugin test will also check to see if the discovered string is in use with standard Python DBAPI calls `execute` or `executemany`, if so, a MEDIUM issue is reported. For example: - cursor.execute("SELECT %s FROM derp;" % var) - First introduced in Bandit v0.9.0 - Significantly improved in Bandit v0.13.0None.. code-block:: none >> Issue: Possible SQL injection vector through string-based query construction. Severity: Medium Confidence: Low Location: ./examples/sql_statements_without_sql_alchemy.py:4 3 query = "DELETE FROM foo WHERE id = '%s'" % identifier 4 query = "UPDATE foo SET value = 'b' WHERE id = '%s'" % identifier 5 - https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Scenario:

1. create a vm using bootable volume.
2. delete this vm
3. restart service nova-compute when vm's task state is deleting.

When nova-compute is up, vm became deleted successful, but the bootable
volume is still in-use state and can't delete it using cinder delete volume.

solve method:

Add init=True in _delete_instance when init_host, and raise exception
when EndpointNotFound exists. It will set vm's status to error and
make user can re-issue a delete.

Change-Id: I67eccc2b60fbe6b9b20cd2d090ba94467efc3d76
Closes-bug: #1408865

commit_message:
fix 'Ignoring EndpointNotFound' error in init host

Add init=True in _delete_instance when init_host,
and raise exception when EndpointNotFound exists.
It will set vm's status to error and make user can
re-issue a delete.

Change-Id: I67eccc2b60fbe6b9b20cd2d090ba94467efc3d76
Closes-bug: #1408865

added_lines: from keystoneclient.v2_0 import client as keystone_client ' allocation on failures'), cfg.StrOpt('admin_tenant_name', default=None, help='name of admin tenant to use to delete instances' 'successful when init host'), cfg.StrOpt('admin_username', default=None, help='name of admin user to use to delete instances' 'successful when init host'), cfg.StrOpt('admin_password', default=None, help='password of admin user to use to delete instances' 'successful when init host') def get_admin_token(self): try: _ksclient = keystone_client.Client( tenant_name=CONF.admin_tenant_name, username=CONF.admin_username, password=CONF.admin_password, auth_url=CONF.neutron.admin_auth_url, insecure=CONF.neutron.api_insecure) self.service_catalog = _ksclient.service_catalog.get_data() return _ksclient.auth_token except Exception as e: LOG.error("Get the token failed, msg: %s" % e) return None def get_admin_context(self, read_deleted="no"): """get auth token of admin and service_catalog for deleting instances successful in init_host process. """ self.auth_token = self.get_admin_token() return nova.context.RequestContext(user_id=None, project_id=None, auth_token=self.auth_token, is_admin=True, service_catalog=self.service_catalog, read_deleted=read_deleted, overwrite=False) if CONF.admin_tenant_name: # fix bug 1408865 context = self.get_admin_context() else: context = nova.context.get_admin_context()

commit_message:
Fix for live migration rollback when using shared storage

If compute nodes use shared-storage no network cleanup happens
on destionation node. So cleanup flag is set to True for every type
of live-migration. Also changed logic for destroy disks.

Closes-bug: #1284719

Change-Id: I205e2d31ec0b29cee76fa2ba72b3e48a7b788b02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/172117/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: do_cleanup = True

subject: Detect a last man standing for rabbit OCF agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-03 12:02:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/5051b8ce103a8feb1951ee3bcbcda714fe23bec0', 'message': 'Detect a last man standing for rabbit OCF agent

W/o this patch, the race condition is possible
when there is no running rabbit nodes/resource
master. The rabbit nodes will start/stop in an
endless loop as a result introducing full downtime
for AMQP cluster and cloud control plane.

The solution is:
* On post-start/post-promote nootify, do nothing, if
  either of the following is a true:
  - there is no nodes rabbit running or no resource master
  - the list of rabbit resources being started/promoted

* For such cases, do not report resource failure and delegate
  recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster"
  monitor's logic.
* Additionally, report about a last man standing when
  there is no running rabbit resources around.

Closes-bug: #1491306

commit_message:
Detect a last man standing for rabbit OCF agent

W/o this patch, the race condition is possible
when there is no running rabbit nodes/resource
master. The rabbit nodes will start/stop in an
endless loop as a result introducing full downtime
for AMQP cluster and cloud control plane.

The solution is:
* On post-start/post-promote notify, do nothing, if
  either of the following is a true:
  - there is no rabbit resources running or no master
  - the list of rabbit resources being started/promoted
    reported empty
* For such cases, do not report resource failure and delegate
  recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster"
  monitor's logic.
* Additionally, report about a last man standing when
  there is no running rabbit resources around.

Closes-bug: #1491306

Change-Id: If1c62fac26b63410636413c49fce55c35e53dc5f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/03/220103/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Do nothing, if the list of nodes being promoted reported empty. # Delegate recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster" monitor's logic ocf_log warn "${LH} there are no nodes to join to reported on post-promote. Nothing to do." return $OCF_SUCCESS # Do nothing, if the list of nodes being started or running reported empty # Delegate recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster" monitor's logic ocf_log warn "${LH} I'm a last man standing and I must survive!" return $OCF_SUCCESS # Do nothing, if there is no master reported # Delegate recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster" monitor's logic ocf_log warn "${LH} there are no nodes to join to reported on post-start. Nothing to do." return $OCF_SUCCESS
deleted_lines: # Report not running, if the list of nodes being promoted reported empty ocf_log warn "${LH} there are no nodes to join to reported on post-promote. The resource will be restarted." return $OCF_ERR_GENERIC # Report not running, if the list of nodes being started or running reported empty ocf_log warn "${LH} there are no nodes to join to reported on post-promote. The resource will be restarted." return $OCF_ERR_GENERIC # Report not running, if there is no master reported ocf_log warn "${LH} there are no nodes to join to reported on post-start. The resource will be restarted." return $OCF_ERR_GENERIC
